Most restaurants were closed so the htoel offered free coffee and a continental breakfast on Thanksgiving day. Valet parking is available at a much more reasonable price than other hotels in the area. All in all a great place to stay only steps from Pike Place Market.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Thanksgiving Weekend at the Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Joyce Z
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in three rooms over the Thanksgiving Weekend and everyone had a great experience! Our harbor-view suite was beautifully appointed and became the perfect meeting place before and after excursions. The activity at the market and in the harbor was as much fun to watch as the football games on TV. The central location made it the perfect spot for an activity packed weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: parth
Reviews.Content: We were there only for a night but that night was perfect. The beds were comfortable and had quality linens. We found the pillows to be too soft and it was late (11) but when we called downstairs asking for firmer pillow, we got them within five minutes. My girlfriend loves the bathroom products and still raves about them. Of course the best thing the the entire hotel is the rooftop. A perfect place to sip a glass of wine and look at the pike place market sign and the sound. You can't beat the location. There are tons of restaurants near by. My favorite is osaka teriyaki a block away. But watch out, there are a lot of homeless people and pan handlers walking around at night. But then you ARE in seattle.

Reviews.Title: “On Top of the World”
Reviews.Author: David T
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally placed near Pike Place Market, great restaurants and entertainment on the water front - all within walking distance. The staff were all most helpful; the rooms most comfortable and the view from the roof garden spectacular! Our other friends in Seattle - 2 couples staying at other hotels - were very envious. The Taylors from Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Seattle and great views”
Reviews.Author: pilsen_pete
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week and the place was amazing. The room size was ok, but it had a floor-to-ceiling windows with a perfect view of the Pike Place Market, the Puget Sound and the mountains on the Olympic peninsula. I would just walk down to the different places around the market for breakfast and lunch, because it is right outside the hotel front door - it was quite awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne49680
Reviews.Content: I had a rough start with some problems with my reservation but the staff more than made up for it. The location and views from the waterview rooms also make this the place to stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Battersea
Reviews.Content: Right on top of Pike's Market and close to the 'waterfront' shopping - this hotel is small and convenient, comfortable and cozy. It is not 'the best' - but, it is perfect for 1 or 2 nights stay. Rooms are a little dated and cookie-cutter and bordering on boring - beds are comfortable, bathrooms are functional - but, the hotel overall lacks any signature features or stand-out elements. Service was friendly (Noel was wonderful, and the valet service was speedy and efficient) - however, the hotel needs an injection of warmth and personality. It was just 'ok' and apart from the excellent location - not anything to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location”
Reviews.Author: TTraveler24
Reviews.Content: If you can afford the cost, there is nothing in Seattle like the Inn at the Market. We love the combination of first-rate accommodations and service and proximity to Pike Place Market.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: janeff08
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for walking around and seeing the city by foot. Tons of restaurant choices, tours, and sights within a few minutes walk, and a beautiful room to top it off. They were very accommodating to an early check in and late check out, great customer service. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: garf47
Reviews.Content: I visited Seattle for the first time last month for a cousin's wedding and extended my stay for a few days on my own to get to know the city. The Inn at the Market was perfect: steps from the Public Market and very easy walking distance to other great sites and/or public transportation to get to points further out. Great bed, awesome waterfront view, nice rooftop deck overlooking the Market and Puget Sound, very friendly and accomodating staff. I've run out of superlatives so I'll leave with: If you go, I hope 'the mountain comes out' as the view is spectacular. Not sure how likely that is, as I believe I actually found a place with fewer sunny days than Rochester NY!

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, but not the best in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: ltycer
Reviews.Content: I am baffled by all the five star reviews this hotel has gotten. It has a great location and the bellman/valet personnel are wonderful, but the hotel overall is average. Nothing special about the service or the hotel. It is a small, somewhat tired property and we were surprised to find ourselves in the handicapped room. The front desk attendant failed to ask if this was acceptable (which, in my experience, is always usually done...even at the Hampton Inn level hotel). My husband couldn't get his head under the shower head without bending over and since it was the handicapped "removable" type shower head it had trouble staying in place. It would slip out of the holder and proceed to flood the bathroom floor since there was no shower ledge separating the shower from the rest of the bathroom floor. We wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “best bed and bedding”
Reviews.Author: sarawelder
Reviews.Content: I always travel with my own down pillow as I usually hate hotel pillows. The pillows here were exceptional.. the best ever hotel pillows.. I won't bring my own next time. The bed was firm with a soft topping.. great for a good night's sleep and perfect for a back that has walked all day. The location is so good that you really can walk most places from here. Staff were all way above average, professional and pleasant. I had a room with a "partial view" of the ocean. Actually I had a spectacular view as I had 3 windows and the city was just as interesting. Lots of natural light was a real plus for me. I would definitely recommend this to a friend and stay here on my next Seattle visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous !”
Reviews.Author: Puddin09
Reviews.Content: Wonderful view Room was very nice Enjoyed my stay Would return

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot!”
Reviews.Author: jena396
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay in Seattle, this hotel offers everything right outside its doors..the Market, the ferry, restaurants, and many things to do and see. The only thing I was missing was a fireplace in the room to warm up from checking out all that Seattle has to offer. The staff was great and the view from our room was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “We were not sleepless in Seattle!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelbev
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our three night stay at this wonderful hotel. First of all the staff is friendly and eager to help in any way. Second the location is perfect for walking to restaurants, the Public Market and shopping. Third we had a wonderful suite with a view of the water, a very comfortable bed., daily newspaper, access to a lovely rooftop lounge, complimentary coffee and it was quiet. Hands down the best stay ever for us in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: musiclady88
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is 1st class! We especially loved the bed! So comfortable we slept like a baby! Great view of the waterfront. Nice rooftop deck to relax on. Walked right out the door to Pike Place Market. Everyone was super friendly and accomodating. Would stay here again in a flash!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay at Inn at the Market”
Reviews.Author: StephanieLuvs2Travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and our 10 month old daughter, stayed at the Inn at the Market for 5 nights at the beginning of October, 2011. We loved everything about it! The staff was very accommodating; the location was perfect (literally steps away from Pike Place Market, and walking distance to many area attractions/restaurants); and the rooftop deck had amazing views! We stayed in a city view townhouse, and it was a great set-up... our baby could sleep/nap upstairs while we utilized the downstairs living area. Each evening we took drinks and snacks up to the deck to enjoy the view. We highly recommend the Inn, and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Get the town house if you have the budget!”
Reviews.Author: Summit4321
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in the two story townhouse. Nice comfortable living room downstairs with wet bar, upstairs bedroom and bathroom. #702 was I think the best room possible, on the 7th and 8th (top) floor in the corner with windows on two sides. The views of Pike Market and Puget Sound could not be beat. Fun to cruise the market and be back at your room in two minutes. Entertained some friends in the room before going to dinner, everyone enjoyed! Beds were like sleeping in a cloud!

Reviews.Title: “above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Diana S
Reviews.Content: Staff went above and beyond. The room and view were outstanding too. No cons at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Seattle, WA hotel”
Reviews.Author: keelx2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Innat at the Market a number of times and it's always my first choice for Seattle. The location is wonderful, within blocks from almost anything you want to visit. The rooms are super comfortable, with beds that are out of this world. But, best of all are the friendliness, competence, and professionalism of the staff. The fact that the Inn is just steps away from the Pikes Place Market is just icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: thefeff
Reviews.Content: Hotel per se is clean, spacious and in a great location. Will stay there again without hesitation. However, I would recommend that you get a room that is not located right over the street as the noise from the street penetrates though the single pane windows. Either higher up or toward the coast view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mover625
Reviews.Content: A great location, very comfortable and good service but .... avoid the rooms fronting 1st Avenue - these can be noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Doris R
Reviews.Content: After 10 days in Alaska we ended our trip in Seattle before flying home. We decided to spring for a water view room and boy were we glad we did. The Pike Street Market sign and Puget Sound were beautiful from our window. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our room was very nice, well appointed and surprisingly quiet considering the location. We loved watching the sunset from the roof terrace. We had breakfast in the cafe and it was delicious. Maybe the best quiche I have ever had anywhere, including home. The room rate is a little steep, but it's worth every penny. You are definitely paying for location and service. We loved the Steelhead Diner right across the street from the hotel. We sat at the bar which was a great place to people watch. The food was great and the atmosphere very pleasant. There are lots of places to shop and eat, but it's a pretty good walk to the water's edge, and once you get there you won't find too much to do - a couple of restaurants and great views. We can't imagine staying anyplace else if we ever go back. The hotel and surrounds were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of the Action”
Reviews.Author: 60sgal
Reviews.Content: This is THE place to stay if you want to be in the middle of the market scene in Seattle. It's delightful to wake up early and walk among the market stalls while the vendors are just setting up. We were fortunate to have gorgeous fall weather when we stayed here in mid-October. We did have a little trouble getting in. The room was not ready at 4 p.m., the normal check-in time, but we couldn't really complain because when we came back at 4:30 the room was ready and we had been upgraded to a suite with a perfect view of the iconic market sign, Elliott Bay and the Olympic Mountains beyond. This was a suite on two floors, with a large living room and kitchen downstairs and a spacious master bedroom and bathroom upstairs. Bed was very comfortable with great reading lights. We caught the beautiful sunset from the hotel's rooftop deck, where a lot of folks were sharing glasses of wine and snapping photos of the view. This is a great base for exploring Seattle. We walked down First Avenue to the Seattle Art Museum's sculpture park near Belltown and then walked back on the waterfront. Had breakfast at Seatown, one of Tom Douglas's newer restaurants, with an emphasis on smoked fish. Also walked the other direction, toward Pioneer Square, and of course checked out the fish, produce and craft stalls in the market itself. My only small caution would be that if you are looking for peace and quiet, this is probably not the place you want to be. The traffic noise from the viaduct below was quite loud all night even though I had my earplugs in. And the market action starts early so if you are a light sleeper you may have trouble sleeping in.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect getaway in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: OrcasParrothead
Reviews.Content: My wife and I FINALLY had a chance to stay at the Inn at the Market. We have stayed at several hotels in Seattle over the past 9 years and the Inn, by far, is the best. Best location, best service (and this is quite an achievement considering all the fine smaller hotels in Seattle), friendliest staff, beautiful, and quiet rooms, and dining that is superb. We booked a water view room and were upgraded to a deluxe water view room. It was fantastic. We dined at Cafe Campagne and it reminded us of many small, but excellent, restarurants that we have enjoyed in Paris. The food was excellent and our server, Courtney, was a gem. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: beshfu
Reviews.Content: We stayed in to room types during our visit. We got a deal for a water view suite. This suite was very, very roomy! The main floor was the living room and small kitchenette with tv. The upstairs was the bedroom and bathroom with another tv. The view was amazing!! It was very clean and very comfortable. My only slightly negative comments would be lack of lighting in the bedroom. Since it was so large, the few lamps at either end of the room did not provide enough light for the middle of the room where the closet was. Also when I stay in luxury hotels, I do expect the bathroom to be way above standard - this one was large, but not with much useful space. There were no drawers/shelves to put toiletries. Also the water pressure was so low. Although there was a nice size tub, it would have taken forever to use it. Plus the shower head had little pressure and was not adjustable so rinsing my long hair took a good amount of time. For the last part of our stay we stayed in a smaller room with a city view. It was really nice - clean comfortable and very well lit. Also the bathroom had shelving to put toiletries and the shower head was adjustable so it felt like more water pressure due to its setting. The hotel overall was magnificent - itâ€™s customer service was everything Iâ€™d expect from itâ€™s ratings. Also it location was great. Iâ€™d definitely recommend this hotel. While the view from the water suite was outstanding, Iâ€™d probably only book it again with a great deal because the smaller room was really nice and I liked itâ€™s bathroom better.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Pike's Place”
Reviews.Author: knittinggrandma
Reviews.Content: The water view room was stunning! It was well lit for reading and knitting. The room was large and very clean. The service is the greatest from the bell persons to the housekeepers to the desk people. I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful oasis in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Barbara K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for a weekend in the middle of September. Even though the hotel is in the front of the famous Pike Market, it is very peaceful and quiet. Our double bed ocean view room on the fifth floor was comfortable, very clean and generous in size. All employees at the hotel are very friendly, helpful and caring. The hotel has a small cute courtyard and a rooftop terrace with amazing ocean and city views. The location is a perfect base for exploring the old and new Seattle. We love everything about the Inn and will definitely come back !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: NorthumberlandTopCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the IATM twice on our recent holiday to the USA, on arrival & on our last night. We arrived at the hotel much earlier than check in time but this wasn't an issue, although our room wasn't quite ready, the receptionist took our mobile number & promised to call us as soon as the room became available, the concierge took care of our luggage and that left us free to stretch our legs, explore and grab a coffee after enduring a 10 hour flight to Seattle. We were in our city view room within the hour & were not disappointed, clean, bright, spacious & wonderful comfy king size bed. After a couple of hours rest, we popped out & bought a bottle of wine and sat enjoying the uninterrupted views of Elliott Bay from the terrace (this is such a bonus). At the end of the evening we returned to our room and housekeeping had replaced the towels, turned down our bed and left us a couple of chocolates, this was a lovely gesture. When we returned to the hotel for our last night we had chosen a room with water view, given that the terrace is available to enjoy the water view, we felt this was an over indulgence, as the room itself (apart from the view) offered nothing more than the city view room, just we payed an extra $76 dollars for the priviledge. All the staff were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them, if we returned to Seattle we'd certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendliest employees, great service!!”
Reviews.Author: AVIDEATER
Reviews.Content: I booked reservations at this hotel because of the responses of manager, David Watkins. I thought someone who cared that much to respond to every trip advisor comment, truly cared about his hotel. He does! This comes across through every single employee, from the second you arrive at the hotel. Everybody employee comes across as happy. Happy to be there, happy to be of assistance, happy to recommend great places for dinner. The rooms were beautiful with fantastic views. The beds are tough to get out of! High quality bedding was wonderful and almost worth spending all day in. My only con...low flow shower. Great for the environment (not for a good shower!) Regardless, I will chose this hotel for my stay, every time I come to Seattle!! Well done, David!!!! Many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “overall we were not disappointed,”
Reviews.Author: kokosandiego
Reviews.Content: and had booked the inn on TA reviews. We arrived very early and tired, the 4PM check in is always an irritant, however, Paul , at the front desk was very considerate concerning our request to check in early and got us right into a room,we will not forget this gesture. The hotel is located in prime tourist friendly territory, and staff were all excellent, helpful, courteous, professional...hotel is very clean, well decorated and very well kept and updated, looked as if it had been recently painted. The terrace on the 5th floor is wonderful, and that is a real plus at this property on warm days of course. Our only complaint ....and we are I am sure much more noise sensitvie than most folks...was the street noise. We had a city view room, the least expensive, and I wish we had been forewarned or I had asked, we might have upgraded. Windows are good sound proof windows but takes alot to drown out buses and motocycles, even from the 5th floor. We had to take sleeping pills in the end. But this was the only complaint...bath was super clean, supplies plentiful and coffee service always available..DOwntown hotels are always expensive, so it was a splurge for us.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences...”
Reviews.Author: 2005highlander
Reviews.Content: This was a special trip so we booked a "water view" King room. Fabulous!! Floor to ceiling windows that opened onto a view of Pike Place Market below and Elliott Bay beyond. The room was large with plenty of storage space and comfortable furniture. And the bed is the most luxurious I've ever slept in--helped, of course, by high-quality bedding and fluffy comforter. Every single staff person we interacted with was friendly and helpful. I had occasion to talk to 2 young men during our stay and they both said that they were proud to work for the hotel because of its fine reputation and quality. That says a lot about a place and about the management. If you're considering a stay at this hotel I encourage you to look at the website. It's an accurate representation of the facility, the rooms, and the attitude. I suppose that the location---right across from the vibrant and fascinating Pike Place Market--might not appeal to everyone, but we loved it. Within 2 blocks of the hotel you can find a choice of good coffee shops and a terrific French Bakery. There are a lot of hotels that deserve an "excellent" rating, often for different combinations of qualities and circumstances. Our experience at The Inn At The Market ranked it among the best hotels we've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Cupcakes and More!”
Reviews.Author: truspaw
Reviews.Content: Staff was outstanding from bell men, front desk staff, to room service personnel. The stay was most memorable when my traveling companion and I ran into Katie from the front desk staff with a plate of gourmet cupcakes in the elevator. We casually commented how great they looked, and returned to our rooms later that day to find a message saying there was "something" special at the desk for us. Katie and her staff went out a purchased a variety of delicious cupcakes and had them delivered to our rooms! The room with a bay view is a must, and worth the small additional cost. The facilities are is pristine condition, and the location in the heart of the Pike/Public Market There is no doubt that I will be returning the the Inn At the Market.

Reviews.Title: “staff--above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: localSanFranciscan
Reviews.Content: Large, pleasantly decorated and clean room and bath, excellent downtown location amid sights, good food and views. The entire staff went above and beyond--pleasantly and efficiently making reservations, advising things to do, printing transportation schedules, many other extras.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it... a lot!”
Reviews.Author: suealias
Reviews.Content: Incredibly pleasant boutique hotel w. a relaxing, casual vibe. 70 rms & compact design promotes easy in & out and all about... no crowds, lines, waits, long corridors or elevator rides... even on a booked weekend, hassle-free! Cut above feature... Outstanding location (Pike Market seems central to everything) and unique, local fare practically outside the door... had fresh crumpets w. honey-butter, ricotta & walnuts every morning! Also, there's "award-winning" clam chowder (serves a 4 chowder sampler... great oyster chowder & seafood bisque) and a "world famous" fresh macaroni & cheese shop... heaven! The other exemplary feature... staff is outstanding... 5 star service. Standard rooms are small-ish, but our 5th flr "city view" actually had views of both city & ocean... nice! My personal draw... faux balcony windows open completely and the 5th flr also has a large, rooftop, lounging deck w. beautiful views. Non-smoking hotel... but smoking ok on rooftop or hotel's front door courtyard. Contemporary decor could use a slight freshen and it's not cheap... crowd skews older. Depending on your budget & taste, highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Seattle”
Reviews.Author: SweetChamois
Reviews.Content: Inn at the Market is hands down the best hotel out there. The staff is neat, friendly and courteous. They go above and beyond to make you feel comfortable and welcome. They even included cupcakes and a card for me, for my 50th Birthday. The location is great, right in the Marketplace. Its a short walk to light rail and buses. The rooms are spectacular, especially the rooms with water views. I will stay there every single time I am in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Even Better Service”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: This isn't a cheap destination but the location is spot on and all aspects of the service provided are top-notch. This really is a case where you get waht you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “A unique experience”
Reviews.Author: JetteE
Reviews.Content: We had a short stop-over in Seattle and chose to stay at this gem. No regrets at all. Wonderful rooms, great staff and service experience; very competent and helpful with good advise for both restaurants and cultural experiences. On top of that a lovely patio and perfect location. Close to Pikes Market, to the first Starbucks and life in Seattle. Don't miss this!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel right by the Pike place market.”
Reviews.Author: HelenCoe
Reviews.Content: Inn at the Market is a charming hotel right next to the Pikes Place market. It has a roof top patio. The lobby is beautiful with a fireplace and many choices of newspapers which my husband loves. It is easy to get to off of I-5. It is just a perfect hotel. The rooms are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “A Seattle MUST”
Reviews.Author: Suzy6450
Reviews.Content: Wow, The Inn at the Market was a perfect hotel choice for our recent stay in Seattle. This was our first visit to Seattle and I wouldn't change a thing about our visit! It is in the Pike Place Market which is a fun venue. We did quite a bit of traveling around the city and whenever we mentioned that we were staying at the Inn at the Market, everyone knew the property and confirmed that we had picked a city treasure. The hotel has the fabulous 5th floor patio which can't be missed and an inviting courtyard within the market area. I am a stickler for smells and this hotel was exquisitely maintained and had a clean, fresh smell. I loved the property from the moment we arrived and felt privileged to be a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndreaSaintPaul
Reviews.Content: This is truly a special hotel. My husband and I always have a great experience in this hotel. Fantastic location, very special staff. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The only place we stay while in Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: michaelcoulbourne
Reviews.Content: This will be short as I watch the sunset into the water and mountains from the 5th floor deck, While sipping a glass of red wine. I believe this is our 3rd or 4th stay, and will always be our choice while visiting Seattle. Couldn't ask for a better location - to my right is the sunset, the neon PUBLIC MARKET sign just to my left. Smell a meal being prepared down below. Rooms are very tasteful, beds quite comfortable. Service from the staff has been consistently good during each visit. I appreciate that they are friendly, personable and helpful. Our partial water view is very partial, but I may be splitting hairs. Great place to stay. Now, back to that sunset...

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Vacation Destination”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth H
Reviews.Content: We had always heard of "Inn at the Market" from relatives and friends. We really wanted to experience the Inn on our pre-cruise night. It was certainly as nice as we expected. The roof-top terrace/seating area allowed us a perfect view of the Pike Place Market as well as the waterfront activities. The location of the Inn allowed us to experience some great restaurants. The staff couldn't have been nicer, from the bell desk to the housekeeping staff. Our room was small but extremely comfortable. We will look forward to going back to Seattle and to the Inn at the Market!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: VATravelbug27
Reviews.Content: We were spending 1 night in Seattle before heading to Portland and chose this hotel for it's awesome location, to make the most of our short time in the city. This was our anniversary trip and the staff did everything to make our night memorable. The location really can't be beat, and we loved enjoying the sun & views from their outdoor terrace. Based on our travel experience, we found this hotel to be a great value for the location, luxurious accommodation & top notch staff! We would definitely stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fun location”
Reviews.Author: Handtiques
Reviews.Content: What a nice time we had every evening on the roof watching the sunset behind the water and mountains! The room was very nice with spacious bathroom and high quality linens. Partial water view has you looking directly down at side street...no balcony's. Only real problem was that window cleaning was to take place from 9am-? this meant we had to keep our "water view" curtains closed until the cleaners finished.You are paying $$$ for the view... We Should have been told this at the time of booking so we could have decided if that's what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional...”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Seattle. I love the location, the rooms and the exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Patrick G
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a great hotel with very friendly and helpful front desk staff. After arranging the room, I worked with the front desk staff to arrange a Town Car to pick my wife and I up at the airport. The driver was on time, professional looking, and very pleasant. The front desk staff also provided helpful advice on things to see and do and were helpful in arranging other transportation during my stay. I stayed in a full water-view room on the 7th floor (Room 704) and was very pleased with the room and the view, which was of Elliot Bay and the north end of Pikes Place Market. The view was quite remarkable! The bed was comfortable.The 5th floor deck was a relaxing and enjoyable way to start the day with a cup of coffee and a piece of fruit from the market below or end it with a glass of wine and good company. The Inn at the Market is right in the heart of the downtown area and extremely close to everything including restaurants, coffee houses, shopping, Pikes Place Market, access to the piers on Elliot Bay, and the many available tours. My wife and I enjoyed breakfast and a latte at Cafe Campagne, just below the hotel, several mornings during our trip. The room I had was quite spacious. However, it was not designed for individuals or families who intend to spend alot of time watching television as the foot of the bed was situated so that it was facing the sliding door toward the view of Elliot Bay. The television was positioned to the side of the bed. This was NOT a problem for my wife and I at all. The bathroom was also quite spacious, though I think it could have been designed more wisely to include a seperate shower space in addition to the bathtub, which was just average. (The water pressure was abover average though) Lastly, the odor from the restaurant vent below entered our room once during our four-night stay. It wasn't very pleasant, however, it dissapated quickly enough after I turned on the quiet fan in the bathroom, which I left running most of the remainder of my stay as a precaution. I would definitely stay at The Inn at the Market again!

Reviews.Title: “Inn at Market is the place for me.”
Reviews.Author: 63impala
Reviews.Content: The wife and I just got back from a trip to Washington. We began our journey in Seattle. We stayed at the Inn at Market. We absolutely loved this place. outside our room was the Public Market neon sign and a beautiful view of Puget Sound. The staff were so pleasant and helpful. The bed was very comfortable. The room was well laid out and gave you a at home kind of feel. This is where we will stay if and when we get back to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “K&K”
Reviews.Author: Kenny K
Reviews.Content: Coast to coast, East to West South to North the Inn at the Market is tops. Not cheap, but you get what you pay for. Room was large as well as bathroom. Fifty yards from Pike Place Market. Outstanding staff. Internet wifi connection perfect. Only place to stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Inn at the market”
Reviews.Author: ChapmanSar
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well positioned, with regards to the downtown area. Close walking distance to the light rail, which we caught from the airport. The room was very clean. The service also great. The only negative was the loud air conditioner. The street noise was minimal. For a first time in the US, it was a great place to start the journey.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: gannic007
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Execellent location in a busy town. We had a room overlooking the sound and the sundown is really something extra. The room was pretty large and the bathroom too! This is THE place to stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.....perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: MBHDE
Reviews.Content: We loved being at Pike Place Market. The hotel was a gem...including the French bistro downstairs. The croissants for breakfast were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience at the Inn at the Market!”
Reviews.Author: MariettaMelissa
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel! Just a few steps away from the Market and every kind of food you could possibly want. I loved everything about the hotel: the bell staff was pleasant and helpful, check-in was a breeze, the room was absolutely gorgeous and well-appointed, a fine walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go. And the wonderful view from the rooftop lounge couldn't be beat. I only stayed for one night before a cruise, but I wished I could have stayed much longer. I had a partial water view on the front corner of the hotel (room 611, try this one out). I can't say enough about it, and I can't wait to stay here again. If you are on the fence about your next Seattle stay, book here. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel, best place to stay in downtown Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: Warren405
Reviews.Content: We travel to Seattle several times a year and since our first stay at The Inn At The Market my wife will not stay anywhere else. Best location and staff. The rooms are spacious and have an understated elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Pleasant, clean, modern, quiet room. Recommended”
Reviews.Author: JAmieskellington
Reviews.Content: If you want a good modern hotel close to tons of great restaurants, bars and shops in downtown Seattle, the Inn at the Market would be hard to beat. Caveat: we stayed in a room on the courtyard, so our experience may be different from other parts of the hotel. It was a very pleasant, comfortable room. I am a very light sleeper and the hotel did an excellent job of honoring my request for a quiet room away from elevators etc. It is amazing how many hotels fail in what should be essential: the " good night sleep" department. But even though the hotel is virtually in Pike's place market, it was quiet and relaxing. I didn't have much interaction with the staff, but found them to be efficient and pleasant. We were only there one night, but I look forward to coming back and trying a cocktail on their rooftop deck! One important note: the hotel reception is tucked in the courtyard of a small upscale shopping complex and the signs are really easy to miss. If you have the right address, you ARE in the right place; just go into the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Seattle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PDXGAL59
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business but will definitely be back for pleasure. Loved everything about this hotel - the lobby, the rooms, the amazing rooftop deck and the location can't be beat! You can walk to everything. The views are spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Great Market Access Location”
Reviews.Author: janescat
Reviews.Content: Very clean, Valet service outstanding (they offered us a ride in their towncar one evening when taxi's were in short supply and we weren't going far). Lunch at Champagne was great. Staff very accommodating. Breakfast room service on time, but missing some items which were quickly delivered. Just wish we could have had outside seating for our room. If you opt for a waterfront room, get one below the 6th floor - the meat cooking smell is pervasive 24/7, with the windows closed.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend - we loved it”
Reviews.Author: CincyGal6000
Reviews.Content: Perfect location overlooking Elliott Bay and Market. Walk to everything. Staff is to be commended on professionalism, friendliness. Couldn't have asked for anything more...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Charlton103
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Inn at the start of a 3 week vacation and it was probably the best hotel we stayed in. The loaction in the heart of Pike Place market is fantastic for the first time visitor, and we've never had so much great fresh food on our doorstep before. The reception area was warm, peacefull and welcoming, and always had bowl of fresh cookies out every afternoon. The hotel isnt a moden statement of cutting edge design, but it fits in perfectly with its surrounding, and has a sophisticated, relaxing, and friendly ambiance. We did have a problem overly loud air conditioning in the room, but this was our only issue. Other than that the rooms were spacious, well designed, had great views, and were an unexpected highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: mayasl
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was fabulous: - The location, right next to the Pike Marketplace, is the best, and from the shared deck you have the best views in town. - The room we had was very spacious. It had two queen beds, two closets, and lots of room to spare. - The room had a coffee maker, dishes and utensils, and free Wi-Fi, something rarely found in high-end hotels. - Every morning we got the NY Times. - The front desk staff was helpful and knowledgable about restaurants, attractions etc. - There's a business center with two computers and printers available to guests for free.

Reviews.Title: “Locations, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: lucinda88420
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits right on top of Pike's Place Public Market. Our room (partial ocean view) had a great view of the market and ferries coming in and out of the harbor. In walking distance to countless shops and restaurants. Breakfast room service was great the first day, but got my order wrong the second day (and didnt have the time to send back for the correct order). There is a beautiful view from the roof top deck, where we sat and drank a bottle of champagne. Staff was all friendly and helpful. Valet parking (extra). Can't beat the location though! All in all, worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Mainly for the location”
Reviews.Author: joedoe587
Reviews.Content: This is pretty much a mediocre hotel and very pricey for the size and quality of the rooms, except for the location, which is fantastic. No breakfast included, but with Pike Place MArkte, you don't really need it.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Carol F
Reviews.Content: We splurged on this modern, comfortable hotel with a great location for anyone who loves Pike Place Market and we do! The front desk staff was excellent and helped us plan our stay but our favorite part of this hotel was the 6th floor roof top patio. It is very comfortable with lounge chairs, couches and a canopied table area with plenty of room to relax each afternoon before going out for the evening. This is an excellent choice

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dar97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at the Market for 5 days in August and had a wonderful experience. Every member of the staff who we encountered throughout our stay was very friendly and helpful. We had a city view room (or whatever the lowest category of room is called) and it was great. We didn't need a water view from the room since we could just go to the rooftop deck anytime for a water view anyways. The city view room allowed us to do some people watching as well. The room was very clean and up to date. There is a small fridge in the room with some beverages you can purchase, but there was also enough room for us to use it to store our own drinks or leftovers from the restaurants. The rooftop deck was so great and I can't imagine staying in a hotel in Seattle without it now that I've experienced it. It really was a great place to enjoy breakfast, lunch, dinner, a sunset, or any other time of day. The housekeeping service was great, and the front desk and bell staff were also super. We even saw orca whales in the bay one morning from the rooftop deck. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Seattle. Great location, great staff & great overall hotel experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: sophiemacc
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, perfect location, large, clean, and modern room with all amenities, exceedingly helpful and friendly staff, and the roof deck is not to be missed--it completed a wonderful hotel experience, whether enjoying morning coffee and (complimentary) newspaper, or an evening glass of wine and sunset over the Olympic Mountains. I will be back, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: harel
Reviews.Content: we recently returned from Seattle and stayed 3 nights at the Inn. It has been said previously but the location at the market is great. The hotel is nice, beds great and people friendly. I would return on my next visit to Seattle. The viewing deck is great and should be used by guest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Brimsmith
Reviews.Content: We stay in a lot of hotels in Seattle, but this is our favorite. The location is great. The service is great. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, nice hotel, & excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NotLostJustWandering
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is simply outstanding. The entire staff makes the extra effort for the guests comfort. If you need something, simply ask, and they will do everything they can to help. When I requested a plastic bag and ice for a sore ankle, within minutes housekeeping delivered it to my room. When I wanted dinner outside the hotel they printed out menus for me, and since I was on crutches and concerned about navigating my way across the street, even offered to pick it up for me! The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The location is fantastic, just half a block up the hill from Pike Place Market. If you can't navigate the hill they will call a cab for you. There were no problems with noise. The hotel itself is accessible. Handicapped accessible rooms have walk in/roll in showers, shower seats, and grab bars the length of the wall. There are ramps onto the deck and elevators to all areas of the hotel. But the doors are not automated. And the deck on the 5th floor overlooking the water and Pike Place Market is a great place to relax and take in the view!

Reviews.Title: “I'm ruined for every other hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: lmm36
Reviews.Content: Rarely am I ever at a hotel where I could be content staying on the premises and/or only explore the immediate area. This is one of those hotels. The room was large and very comfortable, SO clean and beautifully decorated. Even though we had a city view room, there was a window seat where we could open the curtains and see the Public Market sign with the water behind it. At lunchtime, we grabbed some clam chowder from Pike Place Chowder across the street in Post Alley (which was delicious!) and a bottle of wine and went up to the deck where there was a table and chairs for us to relax and enjoy the view as well as check on the action down at the market. The Inn at the Market was the perfect location for us to be able to pop back into our room if we felt like taking a short break, dropping off some stuff, skipping the public bathrooms, etc. Being so close to the market, there were lots of choices for places to grab breakfast, so I didn't miss not having that option included with the room. It was a really nice touch to get a hand-written note upon arrival wishing us a happy anniversary along with some cute, delicious cupcakes. The staff...what can I say? Everyone we came in contact with was friendly, helpful and quick with any request we had. When the housekeeper forgot to stock us with an extra roll of tp and we called down for one, I felt like we'd just hung up the phone and someone was knocking on our door with it! I LOVE this place and would go back in a heartbeat, even though it was a stretch for us to afford it. P.S. I gave them a 4 for sleep quality because I personally don't like feather pillows and spend a lot of time trying to get it "just so". Also, even though the curtains were shut, light from the street seeped in, keeping the room a bit lighter than I would have liked. We put the long decorative pillows on the window seat where the curtains ended and that helped. The bed and comforter was so cozy though!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: SoonerCruiser1
Reviews.Content: Probably the most accommodating hotel my wife and I have ever visited. location, service, friendly people, the best consierge ever,and on and on. Would go back in a heart-beat!

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal location and good quality hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lenkag
Reviews.Content: If you are lucky enough to stay here for a reasonable rate take the opportunity to do so. Rooms are quiet, clean, well appointed, clean, nicely decorated, clean, sizeable, clean, and with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annie M
Reviews.Content: The staff were incredibly friendly and efficient, rooms very comfortable and the location is really excellent. Its a 50 yard walk to Pikes Place market and all the lovely shops along that road. Its our third time staying at the Inn at the Market and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - If You Can Afford It”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: Glowing reviews are usually suspect, but this place certainly deserves it. The location is half a block from Pike Market, and a short walk from the light rail from the airport. Our room faced the bay and was pretty much perfect - quiet, with a separate sitting room and a view to die for. The bathroom was fairly large and the bed really, really comfortable. The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful. They give you the choice of two newspapers or, if you want, both. The only complaints (if you even want to call them that) is 1) no turn down service (a surprise at such a nice place) and 2) the television is in a weird place, sort of on the side of the bed. Picky, picky, picky... This hotel is not cheap, but for a couple of extra bucks it definitely is worth it. We can not imagine staying elsewhere in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RexT
Reviews.Content: Although not inexpensive, the Inn is an exceptional hotel. Staff, location, and the room itself were simply excellent. Could not ask for a better location in downtown Seattle. Immediate access to virtually everything. Beautiful room; extremely comfortable. The 5th floor terrace was simply fantastic. We spent many hours there with a glass of wine or two over a 3 day stay. I would not hesitate to stay here again or to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Love the rooftop views”
Reviews.Author: rxrteam
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Inn and throughly enjoyed our stay. The location is great and having the option to valet park makes it very easy to stay so close to Pike's Market. The highlight was sitting on the rooftop garden sharing a glass of wine. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanpete
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel was our first introduction to the Pacific Northwest and we loved it. It's located just a block from Pikes Market, a wonderful place to people watch, eat, shop, etc. The hotel is through a pretty courtyard with some nice specialty shops opening on to it. The lobby is small and rather plain, but the rooms were lovely. We looked out on the courtyard and didn't miss having a water view at all. Upstairs was a rooftop terrace with nice lounge chairs and tables where we could spend time looking at Puget sound and visiting with other guests. We didn't use the restaurant affiliated with the hotel so can't comment on that but the menu looked great. The room itself had everything we needed - extremely comfortable beds, lovely bathroom, TWO floor-length mirrors (one inside the bath, one outside - that's a frequently lacking item even in top hotels), comfortable chairs. It was spotless - and I'm picky. Would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Positively The Best In Seattle”
Reviews.Author: mpirog85
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Inn at the Market for three nights in the second week in August and wished it could have been longer. After a long day of driving up the Oregon coast we arrived late to a courteous staff and found in our room a complimentary bottle of wine. I had booked a city view room but found I had been upgraded to a partial water view. The room was superb, not extremely large but very luxurious. The bed and linens were great though the pillows are very soft. The bathroom is nicely updated and always very clean. I did have some trouble with the shower as the showerhead was a little low but not everyone will have the same issue. The soaps and shampoos are on par with other fine hotels weâ€™ve stayed at. The staff was professional, helpful and provided good advice on how to get places. The Inn provides numerous snacks and drinks in the room for purchase which didnâ€™t seem overpriced, wireless internet is free, and the complimentary New York or Los Angeles Times is a great touch. Itâ€™s been mentioned in just about every review but the location cannot be beat and it worth the price of the room. It allows you to go to the market before it gets busy, and is close walking distance to everything but the Space Needle and Safeco. The rooftop deck will make you realize that youâ€™ve spent your money wisely as you get to enjoy what makes Seattle a great city. I would advise going to Piroshky Piroshky for breakfast and Beecherâ€™s Cheeses for lunch as they are right around the corner and taking both up to the rooftop deck to enjoy a great view and better meal. Overall we were greatly impressed with the luxury and professionalism of the Inn at the Market, would recommend it to anyone staying in Seattle and will stay there upon our return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: Americophile_32
Reviews.Content: This was the first part of our West Coast trip and what a great hotel. Beds were great, nice staff, and a brilliant start to a lot of sightseeing. The rooms are not huge but big enough, but overall the location makes this place and its worth the extra sterling for access to the market, ferries, and walking into the shopping areas. With little onsite, the hotel makes use of surrounding facilities which is nice if, like us, you like to get out of the hotel - the surrounding bistro, cafe etc can bill to your room, even though it feels like you have got out and about already (as opposed to the welcome but generic 'Marrisson' scrambled egg fare. Parking is not cheap, but then when is it in central US cities - there are plenty nearby that are cheaper if you don't need the car much. Overall, would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Andrea N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had seen the Inn at the Market a few years ago on vacation and had decided that we would like to stay there on our next visit so I really looked forward to staying at this hotel which is directly across the street from Pike Place Market. But I was truly disappointed. Although the Bellman were superb, the front desk personnel and concierge were sorely lacking in being service-oriented. When asking for a suggestion of a nearby restaurant, I had to ask several questions just to get the name of one restaurant across the street which had a 2.5 hour wait and had been told by this front desk rep that we would not need reservations. On a few occasions during our two-day stay, one of us asked for suggestions and it was like pulling teeth just to get a suggestion. They were never rude but just not helpful as you might expect from personnel at a fine hotel. I'm sorry to leave such a terrible review which I RARELY do but I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best...hated to leave”
Reviews.Author: cshaw049
Reviews.Content: The only two negative things I can say are 1) the windows didn't open and 2) valet parking seemed to be really expensive. Wish we could have stayed longer!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Tmac0810Baltimore
Reviews.Content: If you stay at this hotel you will not be disapointed! The hotel was clean and centrally located. I have stayed at a lot of hotels and by far this is one of thebetter ones. The staff and even the bellman went out of their way to help you. The rooms were clean and spacious. They also have on the 5th floor a quaint terrace and it had tables and chairs out there for your usage. My husband and I had a bottle of wine and cheese up on the terrace and we enjoyed the scenic view. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Small (boutique) hotel with decent room space but not worth the room rate per night.”
Reviews.Author: hoohiki
Reviews.Content: After reading the various reviews from many travel websites, including TA, I chose to make reservations at this quaint boutique hotel because of its location adjacent to Pike's Place Market. The only downside to being in this crowded vicinity was that the site of the hotel was on a very small lot sandwiched between stores and other apartment buildings. It just felt a little too claustrophobic. The compensation for this dilemma is the wonderful common balcony area on the second floor which overlooked Pike's Place Market partially and afforded a full view of Seattle Harbor. On the flipside, because of the location, it was very convenient to grab meals anytime of the day because of the various delis and restaurants in the area. Also, it was walking distance to shopping malls, supermarkets, movie theaters and not to mention, the original Starbucks just down the hill. Be wary, though, of the many panhandlers and homeless when walking about. If you have a car, there is no self parking unless, you can find a public parking garage somewhere close by, otherwise the hotel has valet service and there is a parking charge of about $30.00 per night. Despite the fact that the location is in a busy neighborhood, the noise factor was remarkably not an issue, especially since we were on the second floor overlooking the street and stores. We had a room with double beds and ample room for a family with 2 active boys. It was clean and neat, but nothing spectacular. I thought the staff were cordial enough and helpful, but not overly helpful. The place exuded a very low key ambiance. Maybe it was the dim lighting or the fire place in the lobby that contributed to the effect. Overall, the room was decent, the hotel was small, the location was adequate, the atmosphere was sublime and the staff were professional. The room rate is perhaps justified because of the location at Pike's Place Market where everything seems to be overpriced. Not that I had an unpleasant experience at Inn at the Market, mind you, but I probably would try another hotel in Seattle, just for the change in scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mr_hand
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a townhouse city side suite with my wife and 2 kids (2 and 8) on our summer trip. The location is just steps from the market which is great for walking to grab breakfast and dinner and is also close to catch the monorail to some of the activities in the city. The patio for the guests was great. The only improvement we'd like to see is a larger bathroom as it was extremely small and cramped. Other than that the two level suite was great.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly great, but some flaws”
Reviews.Author: BeforeSunrise
Reviews.Content: There is a lot that is fantastic about Inn at the Market. If you're on a pleasure/vacation trip, you cannot beat the location - on the edge of the market but still quiet and relaxing once you're in your room. The staff is fantastic - everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful above and beyond normal niceness. The room we had was quite large and our view of the Sound was absolutely dreamy. Worth noting though, our room had very few outlets which were in awkward places for charging devices (computers, cell phones, etc). And there is no desk in the room. The most inconvenient and impactful problem though was that our room (704) was very close to the exhaust fan of the restaurant below. So, it smelled intensely like eggs (breakfast) and then steak (lunch/dinner) the entire time the restaurant was open. This seems like something the hotel should be aware of and should really correct, especially for being one of the upgraded water-view rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous inn”
Reviews.Author: BerBan
Reviews.Content: A fabulous inn...great location...all staff were gracious, friendly, and very helpful. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “So good, already have another reservation set!”
Reviews.Author: Deni6
Reviews.Content: Hotel is Seattle's gem. My daughter and I were having a girls vacation for her 18th birthday and high school graduation present. We had a view right into the public market and out onto the water. Beds are great and they have turn down service with chocolate, who could ask for more! Only complaint is the small shelf in the bathroom for toiletries. With two females it was not enough. The soaps are great, but the lotion they put in the rooms is divine! Already have another reservation for next month on the books. Please don't forget the roof top viewing deck for a great view, especially at sunset, but do bring a sweater or blanket.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: golfer_diner
Reviews.Content: This property has a great location, attentive staff, and very comfortable and attractive rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Town house water views are the best!”
Reviews.Author: Ruby&Cody
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a one night stay in the water view duplex unit. Kids had downstairs and we in the upstairs bedroom. Luxurious. Great location. Windows open right in front of the Pike Place Market. You can't be more centrally located than this! Ate across the street at Steelhead. Great food. Would come back even though it's expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Continues to be outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte_S
Reviews.Content: I have just come back after several years absence, which was my fourth stay at the Inn. I was relieved to see that it is better than ever. The entire staff is extremely courteous, professional, and accommodating. The location and intimacy of this small hotel can't be beat for anyone wanting a true Seattle experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Abagail
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time at Inn at the Market! My teen daughter's and I were in Seattle for the first time and a very short trip also. We did not rent a car and opted for a car service from the airport that charged $60 for airport pick up. A cab is $50...no brainer! This place is just adorable. From the courtyard with shops and restaurants to the large patio over-looking Pike Market and the harbor, it was perfect. The best part is that it is steps from EVERYTHING! We booked a water view room but got upgraded to a room with a huge private patio. I cannot say enough about the view and what a great place it was to sit morning and night! I really loved my stay here immensely. Comfy beds and pillows(asked for a tempur-pedic pillow and they had them...score!) You will not regret your stay here if your primary activities are in and around the market. Try Lola for dinner. Delicious and casual Mediterranean cuisine. One negative---no pool or fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Cute but facing some competition.”
Reviews.Author: spep4
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Inn at the Market before and always loved it. This time we were in town for just one night. The Inn was still as cute and well located as always. But I must admit to feeling that maybe it is a bit overpriced. With the Four Seasons next door now, the Inn has more competition than it used to. I also found the bellman completely unhelpful. But that's probably an aberration. Overall, still nice. But next time we may opt for the FS, whereas in the past the Inn has always been our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location...I would absolutely return!”
Reviews.Author: Judyluter
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location. Although I would rather not pay as much, it was a great hotel and you get what you pay for. City view room's view was not quite as good as expected, but rooms with ocean views were very nice. Very clean, up to date. Luxurious. Sink is in the bathroom. While not a plus for me, it was not really a problem for this short trip anyway.

Reviews.Title: “unexpected treat”
Reviews.Author: mistvale
Reviews.Content: Every time you make a reservation, you wonder if the hotel will wow you. I have to tell you that this hotel did more than that. It started as soon as we arrived from the bellhop to the front desk, but the most amazing part was opening the door to our room and realizing it was just more than we imagined. The warm and relaxing atmosphere that the room exuded was just perfect. The room and its bathroom was immaculate from the sheets to the toilet. The bed was unbelievably comfortable. Everything was perfect. When i come back to seattle, i am for sure going to stay here and i would recommend it to anyone staying in the Emerald City.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DorothyLi
Reviews.Content: In November, I went with my husband on a short trip to Seattle. We didn't want to rent a car so we booked Inn at the Market. This was a GREAT location and the service was good. The room we were given was a nice size with a comfortable bed. This place was right across the street from Pike's Market. We were able to go everywhere easily on foot. I generally don't go to the same place twice and I haven't to date. This however is on my list of places to visit again and soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Iris042
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over July 4 weekend and had an excellent time. Wonderful view of the water in even a partial-view room (the full ocean view rooms were booked). The observation deck is well worth the price of staying here and the location by the market is incomparable. Great room service options too. The rooms were quite nice and surprisingly quiet. The beds were supremely comfortable. My only complaint is the awful unsupportive pillows, be they foam or down, that I seem to find in so many upscale places including this one. I just want something that doesnâ€™t squish completely flat when I lie on my side. Other than that, I would definitely stay again. We were a little busy during our trip so didnâ€™t get to spend as much time at this place as we would have liked given the amenities and price. Taking the train from the airport is a great tip I picked up here. Walking a few blocks from the station to the hotel with my little rolly bag was easy. It would have been awful trying to drive around the market area.

Reviews.Title: “Got upgraded room for our anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: KCano
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. I had stayed at the Four Seasons Seattle last year and loved that, too. When I reserved the room, I mentioned it was our wedding anniversary. When we checked in, they had upgraded us to a townhouse for no extra charge! And gave us this amazing dessert to split with a card signed by the staff. The place is so nice and right near everything. I liked it equally as much as the Four Seasons, and it was a much more affordable price. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone I know travelling to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: louise_craigen
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times. You cannot beat the location: steps away from The Market and stunning views of Elliott Bay. We arrived late morning after a 6-hour flight from Philly and were able to check in right away to our beautiful room overlooking the bay. All the staff we encountered were cheerful and helpful. (Come to think of it, everyone we encountered in Seattle we cheerful. Do they put something in the water?) The only disappointment was the temporary closure to Campagne, the hotel's restaurant. It's been closed for renovations for some time.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing short of perfect”
Reviews.Author: leesvillelake
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights prior to a cruise from Seattle. We had booked only an ordinary room, but we were given a corner water-view room just above the "Public Market" sign at Pike Place Market. The location is fantastic with the market and all the restaurants nearby. We enjoyed several lunches of delicacies from the market while sitting on the roof terrace of the hotel and overlooking the bay. Just a block or so away is a large Macy's Department Store and the tram to the Space Needle. Some cruise ships dock just below the market and Inn, but Holland America docks a short taxi ride away. The staff is wonderful; when a tour company the concierge recommended overcharged us for a tour, the overcharge was deducted from our hotel bill. This is the perfect hotel in the perfect location. What else can I say?

Reviews.Title: “The top hotel for location and service”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonFlyer
Reviews.Content: For location this hotel cannot be beat. Within seconds of Pike Place Market, great restaurants, Benaroya Hall and the Triple Door theater. Small scaled, but lovely. The rooms are nice sized, very comfortable beds, exceptionally clean, and modern. Also our room was very quiet. We love picking up food and a bottle of wine at the market, and having a picnic on the 5th floor deck overlooking the bay and the market. The hotel is expensive but worth it for a splurge. $30 for valet parking is steep, but the service was efficient and friendly. Cafe Campagne, the in house restaurant, is top notch as well. Fabulous food and terrific wine list. The main restaurant Campagne is still undergoing a remodel and I don't know when it will re-open.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, personalized service expected in a boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LukeTurpin
Reviews.Content: Great location, hotel and staff do a great job incorporating that into their service. Friendly and excited. Very refreshing and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE TO SAY IN SEATTLE”
Reviews.Author: GrammaDiane
Reviews.Content: Wonderful beautiful, large and clean rooms made our stay fabulous. In room amenities are 5 star quality. The hotel is 3 blocks from the bus and metro so we were able to get to all the attractions easily and inexpensively. BE SURE TO ASK FOR SENIOR AND CHILD RATES ON THE BUS AND METRO. I Suggest the city attraction pass as it saves money and you can see the best the city has to offer. PIKES MARKET IS 1/2 A BLOCK AWAY. WE WERE A FAMILY OF 6 AND WE ALL LOVED THE HOTEL. For breakfast visit BRACCO around the corner from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel during our vacation along the West Coast”
Reviews.Author: SwissTravler09
Reviews.Content: We just wrapped up a 14 day vacation along the West Coast. We stayed in a number of hotels - among them even a Ritz Carlton in Half Moon Bay, CA. However, the Inn at the Market exceeded our expectations and the service we received will have me talking for a long time to come. A few weeks prior to our trip, I contacted the manager at the hotel to learn more about the hotel, rates, amenities and its location. I was provided with all the information requested and offered a nice room at a fair rate and was told that I wont be disappointed. This turned out to be sooo true! When we arrived, the bellman took our bags and suitcases and told us "not to worry",..all bags would be wisked to our room . We checked in and were given a map of Seattle, our room keys by the friendly reception staff. This felt so right! Our room was awesome. It was on the 5th floor ..same level at the our door roof patio with the most fabulous view of Elliott Bay. Our beds were terrific, the bathroom huge and decorating a table by the window was a plate of mini cupcakes which welcomed us and made us feel at home. The hotel is located 100 meters from Pikes Market Place, the first Starbucks Coffee Shop and an awesome breakfast restaurant - Bacco's. They offer a number of excellent and refreshing juices for breakfast along with a great french toast! Love it! As we were sitting on the patio, I was compelled to "check in" to this Hotel via Facebook and was told I should goto the front desk to pick up my complimentary gift. To my surprise, we picked up a FREE bottle of red wine. Pinch Me! When we left, the bellman loaded our bags and asked if we needed directions to our next destination! Its the little details that count so much! Thanks Inn at the Market for an awesome stay!! So many hotels,..including the Ritz could learn so much from you! A must stay for anyone!

Reviews.Title: “The best possible experience”
Reviews.Author: Tareyece
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Inn many times....there are not many places we walk in and they greet us by name, we know that the room will be perfect and we can just simply relax. The Inn is the one exception......the staff is amazing, the room has breath-taking views, the location is unbeatable, the linens are impeccable. There is quite simply nothing I would ever change. We go back several times a year because they take such excellent care of us!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: vacationer0
Reviews.Content: Can't imagine a better location in Seattle right above the market and waterfront. Hotel was clean and classy and has an incredible furnished rooftop deck with an outstanding view of the bay. Only suggestion: Reception staff responded to all questions but were a little aloof and could have been more friendly and welcoming. Highly recommend, it even appears in the Sleepless in Seattle movie.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MLBaker_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location, staff were very nice and competent.

Reviews.Title: “Great refuge after camping/worthwhile splurge”
Reviews.Author: kewpie1
Reviews.Content: Wow, thought I had died & went to heaven when I fell into the bed after 2 nights of camping w/minimal amenities (no showers or running water.) Additionally, I had to order room service from Cafe Campagne, which was utterly delicious! The location was dead center for visiting Pike's market; and availability to visit the rooftop & enjoy the city & Puget sound views are an additional bonus. Plus the staff were very amenable to helping us plan some future outings. Granted it was high season, but worth the expense for location & convenience. I liked that we didn't have to pay for wi-fi. We didn't use any other services tho, but location, location, location!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Market”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugSpokane
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel because it is so close to PIke Street Market. They also have a wonderful rough top terrace that is a great place to relax with wine & cheese - watching the ferry traffic on the Sound. The only complaint that I used to have about this place was the bed - which was worse than a rock - but they have new beds so this place is perfect if you want to stay close to the Market and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “What a marvellous Inn to stay!”
Reviews.Author: AlohaRaymond
Reviews.Content: My wife and I absolutely loved our stay at Inn at the Market. All the staff at the front desk are so friendly and helpful. We called before our trip and Maria the staff was so helpful over the phone to give us travel and transportation information. Taylor at the front desk was very welcoming when she checked us in. The Inn's central and most convenient location has been mentioned by other reviewers. We can't agree more. It is literally a hop and a jump to the Pike Place Market, especially to our now favorite bakery La Panier which is literally right across the street down the hill in a less than1 min walk. We love the decor at the Inn. It has an European flair in a understated and very cozy way. The Inn's courtyard is so charmiing, with a lovely sculpture at the center, surrounded by high quality small boutiques. The Cafe serves delicious French cuisine. The manager and wait staff are nice there also. Our room at the Inn has a partial bay view which is lovely. We also enjoyed hanging out at the roof deck common area to see the beautiful sunset over Eliott Bay. Seattle is a very charming city, and we find staying at the Inn at the Market really made our trip so special because of the friendliness of the front staff staff. The cleaning staff also greeted us each morning and afternoon with big smiles and warm greetings. The location, decor, services, and comfort level of the Inn are truly appreciated. We will go back to stay there for sure. In fact, we have already made reservation for the next summer and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: jmbdt
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 preteen sons, my husbands parents, brother-in-law, and his girlfriend all stayed here post Alaskan cruise for 4 nights starting June 25. We arrived very early and were impressed from the start. Everyone we came into contact with was extemely nice and welcoming. I did not expect any rooms to be ready (10 am), but wanted to check our bags. One of our 3 rooms (2 Queen beds) was ready, so we had all of our bags sent to this room so we could freshen up. Our 2 Queen room was much larger than I had expected and was also able to fit a rollaway bed, which they happily provided. This alone made our stay better since our boys would be less likely to fight over pillows, the spot next to the table, etc. Our window faced a side street but had a beautiful view of the water to the left. There was a table and 2 chairs in front of the window where I liked to sit with my laptop and look out over the water. We had a fridge/ minibar, microwave, and large closet with many shelves. The bathroom was beautiful, clean and huge. I liked the bath products very much. The hairdryer left a lot to be desired for my long hair. I have yet to find a decent one in a hotel, so I always bring my own. We dropped our bags and went off to checkout the rest of the hotel and Public Market. I have to say that even if the hotel hadn't been as nice as it was, I still would have paid what I did (250 King city view and 320 2 Queen ) for the rooftop deck and proximity to Public Market. The deck is large with several tables with chairs, a few lounge chairs and an outdoor living room set. It looks directly over the market and the water. I went up every morning with my coffee and whatever treat I picked up at the Market. We also spent each evening up there reviewing our day's adventures over a bottle of wine. It was perfect. The location of the hotel cannot be beat if you truly want to be in the heart of it all. It is actually a part of the Market, so you walk out the door of the hotel, through its little courtyard (which I love) and you are there. It was wonderful to be able to wander at my leisure during the off hours than suffer the rat race that the Market can become in the middle of the day. If you haven't been to Seattle, it is filled with steep hills. Even though we were in a great location, my husband's parents usually called a cab to go anywhere beyond the Market. The rest of us easily walked to our destintation or to the bus tunnel or monorail. We did walk to Safeco Field as well (about a mile), but opted to take a cab back since going back was all uphill and we were tired. The hotel staff, as expected, were very helpful with checkout. The loaned us a scale for our luggage (airline fees :( ) They also helped us to arrange a van to the airport. I was very sad to leave this hotel and hope I have the opportunity to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: RayCWestfordMA
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel! My second stay here; room is big, clean, and well-equipped. The service is excellent and the rooftop deck is a great place to end the day with a nice bottle of wine. Wonderful view overlooking the market and bay. The location is great; Pike's Place market is literally just steps away, and there are many great restaurants and activities within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: XinAn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Inn at the Market the end of June with my two daughters. We had a double bed room and a great view of the market and the water. We were at the end of a long trip and I wasn't sure I even still wanted to stay in Seattle - but once I saw my room and location I totally changed my mind. The beds were cozy and loved the chocolates at night with our turn down service. Loved being so near to Pikes Market and being able to walk to get breakfast, coffee, and just to eat and look around. The Inn does have restaurant service but we didn't try it - but it sounded great. Just not too child friendly. I'm not sure the Inn really is looking for children clientle as there were many couples. However, we never felt uncomfortable. My kids loved the room. I really appreciated that everytime I asked staff for directions they always gave me excellent tips and I soon discovered we were really close to everything we wanted to see!! I also appreciated the free business center, coffee in the room, and the cookies and apples at night,. This hotel is not cheap but it definately was worth the splurge. It made out time in Seattle extra special. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: sandrapulham
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best places we have stayed in some time Front dest staff very helpful and informative, near the nmarket, ferries,, and anything elsae one could want in Seattle The room is great, clean, bed turndown each night, and best of all, the deck loverlooking the harbour. The beds are the most comfortable we have had in a hotel in some time.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel and phenomenal location!”
