Reviews.Author: Michigan6
Reviews.Content: Just a lovely hotel - beautiful rooms, outstanding location in relation to Pike Market and the waterfront, and a gracious and responsive staff. Outstaning hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We will return with great anticipation.”
Reviews.Author: mkdon1
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Inn at the Market. We then went to Vancouver for a week, then returned to the Inn at the Market for another day. We truly enjoyed each and every moment there. The location is superior. It is a half block from the Pike Street Market. It is also a block from a bus stop. It is within walking distance from the downtown terminus of the light rail (about 4 blocks). There is a selection of restaurants in the immediate area. The stadiums are about a half hour walk from the Inn at the Market. The waterfront is even closer. In other words, the location of awesome. The rooms were very cozy and clean. The staff came around and asked if we wanted our bed turned down and left chocolates each day. The entire staff from the front desk to the cleaning staff were friendly and kind. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to any visitor. There is also a rooftop patio with planty of seating and a great view of Puget Sound as well as the Pike Street Market. There are only 70 rooms so each guest gets plenty of attention. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love Inn at the Market!”
Reviews.Author: ncwriter3
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Inn at the Market - the first time, several years ago, we were staying at the Fairmont and stumbled upon "The Inn" on a walk to Pikes Market. We knew at that time, any future visits to Seattle would include a stay at the Inn at the Market. Service is impeccable (and, hotel staff so friendly!), the beds comfy, nice bath products...all that you would expect at a hotel at this price point. Go for a view room, if you can. We had the good fortune to stay in a deluxe water view room and I must say that having a glass of wine on a deck overlooking the Sound was second only to waking up and having coffee on a deck overlooking the Sound! I could get picky and say that it would have been nice to have a double sink in the bathroom - that thought popped into my head for a second - but you will see, the place is so not about that.

Reviews.Title: “If you can find better I'd like to know about it.”
Reviews.Author: honorship
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful view, large room - I mean very roomy.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: caprichmio
Reviews.Content: Excellent location....Very helpful staff....I was traveling with my eight year old son and we arrived very late at night from a very long trip super tired....They had everything ready for us when we arrived, excellent service with a friendly and familiar feeling....I just loved this hotel.....Oh and by the way, the bed....My gosh....you are sleeping in heaven....!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back whenever we are in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: 2Jan
Reviews.Content: Very spacious rooms and the staff was the most courteous and professional people. The bell hops were the best and most helpful in getting us settled in our room. The room is well equipped with everything you need and I personally loved the large soaking tub! You will love this Inn and it's views and comfort in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, hotel, location and view!”
Reviews.Author: Charlene212
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things to say about this hotel. The staff was professional and helpful with any of my needs. I will always pick this hotel to stay in when in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous little gem”
Reviews.Author: MARINAROSEK
Reviews.Content: A lovely, small hotel near the world famous market. They have a gym deal two blocks away. The rooms are relatively small - I was on a high floor so the noise from the main road not too bad. The beds are very comfy. The staff were very helpful and the location is fantastic - right in the middle of everything and easy walking distance to all local attractions, including shops, museums etc. Wifi is free. Valet parking is charged by the day.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service done right”
Reviews.Author: jvenneberg
Reviews.Content: We live here about an hour outside Seattle. We occasionally stay downtown for an evening event instead of driving home late. We were in town to go to the symphony and the next morning my husband had a meeting. We were first in need of assistance when my husband needed a seam in his suit pants mended. I stopped by the front desk on our way out asking for a needle and thread. They sent up the most little amazing sewing kit to the room. The next morning my husband got up and at 7 am there was NO hot water for a shower. I called down to the front desk and they said they were just aware of the problem and were working on it. He didn't have time to wait, so had to take a very cool quick shower. He mentioned it to the front desk on his way out and they said they would adjust the bill but not any more. When I checked out ( after getting a hot shower at 9) they had taken our room charge from $255 down to $99. I was surprised and delighted and appologized again for the inconvenience. They couldn't solve the problem in time for his shower, but they made up for it the way a first rate hotel should. We will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Inn at the Market is our favorite Seattle hotel”
Reviews.Author: Penny N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at the Market for one night before a cruise. We chose room 810 for the view and were not disappointed. Another reason for picking that room was space. We were on a 2-week trip with varying clothing requirements so we needed room for 4 large suitcases. Our luggage nearly disappeared in the closets and alcoves which kept the room looking tidy. The view of Puget Sound was outstanding. The hotel is attached to our favorite Seattle restaurant, Campagne, right at Pike Public Market and near good shopping. Very safe neighborhood for walking in the evening. We were also happy that an AVIS lot was close to the hotel so that we could drop off our car and walk downhill with our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: DavoRutland
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at this wonderful hotel, we were greeted with those magic words "we have upgraded you"! This was to room 414 and it was one of the best rooms I've ever stayed in. The whole hotel oozes class at a reasonable price and all the staff were friendly and efficient. I will always return here when in Seattle and suggest you do the same!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: elegantraveller
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our choice. Following Trip Adviser reviews paid off once again. The hotel is ideally located directly across from the market in the middle of a busy and interesting area. In spite of this, it's quiet and a haven of peace, particularly on a warm afternoon when a couple of hours sitting comfortably on the roof terrace is a great break from the hustle and bustle down below. Our 5th floor, water view rooms were spacious and clean. The beds were remarkably comfortable and the huge bathroom functional and well appointed. We weren't too fussed about the clingy shower curtain but this is a small niggle in proportion to everything else. Free wifi internet, complimentary daily newspapers and efficient reception/bellhops/housekeeping staff all contribute to making this a great place to stay. We'd recommend The Inn on the Market without question!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and a Marvelous Location -- within the Pike Place Market”
Reviews.Author: Birdie2050
Reviews.Content: This luxury hotel is a gem tucked into the center of the Pike Place Market. The hotel is quiet and smart. The rooms are spacious. The roof deck provides a spectacular view of the market and Sound. This is definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit sloppy”
Reviews.Author: Jim6851
Reviews.Content: Water view and market access superb. Clean and comfortable. Good WiFi access. Staff if asked will help. We had three major problems which point to sloppy management: 1. Our room had a noisy smelly restaurant exhaust working overtime just outside the window. 2. Front desk advice on public transport was belatedly and reluctantly provided and was extremely inaccurate causing much trouble. and 3. Security: Our room was found locked open on our return after a late night out.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a must-stay on any trip to Seattle, Washington!!”
Reviews.Author: shasue67
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely - lots of space and plenty of comfort. The rooftop deck provided spectacular views of Puget Sound, the Olympic Mountains and surrounding attractions. The staff was friendly and welcoming; they really made us feel right at home, and the location was perfect, of course! We will definitely stay here anytime we return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations along with Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: dahlia8
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms at the Inn at the Market back in March. 3 weeks ago we needed another room. I got 2 nights but needed one night more. I called each and every day, sometimes twice a day, for 3 weeks trying to get that one night to no avail. Maria who was in reservations took my call 5 out of 7 days a week. She knew me by name. The day before we were to arrive I called one last time and got Maria, same story, no rooms were available. Defeated, I cancelled my reservations. I was bummed because this is where I've always wanted to stay. An hour later, I got a call from Noelle, the reservations manager, who informed me that a room had opened up and the reason she called me back was because Maria had told her of my diligence. I was thrilled! The Inn at the Market has a location that can't be beat! It is steps away from Pikes Market, about 1/2 a mile from the monorail, close to shopping and many restaurants and the rooms are clean with very comfortable beds and the staff, is so very friendly and helpful! There is a balcony on the 5th floor with views of Mt. Ranier as well as surrounding mountains and the beautiful ocean. A wonderful hotel complimented by a wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: rosscannon
Reviews.Content: Inn at the Market is great place to stay. Well appointed rooms; great view of Elliot Bay from most rooms; friendly staff; daily papers [WSJ; NY Times; local papers delivered to your door; friendly bell staff. You can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwraff
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a nice hotel. The room my wife and I had was very nice, but this was not the best hotel I have stayed at. I guess from the reviews I was expecting something amazing. The deck was the best part of the hotel. You could sit out there and relax and look at the water or the crowds down at the fish market. The ladies & gentlemen at the front desk were nice and efficient and did their job well. I think the price you pay for staying there is for the location. You are right there by the market and the downtown area, which is quite convenient. I would say if you want to stay at a hotel that is conveniently located and is a nice little hotel, then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with amazing harbour views.”
Reviews.Author: marie_scott83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem, located really near to Pike Place market. The rooms were amazing. We had a view on the harbour with huge windows. We could have easily spent our whole time in the room. The bed was amazingly comfortable. There is a great little antiques market near the hotel and great restaurants in the vicinity. We were able to walk to the space needle (about 15-20mins) but there are several options for public transport. The Aquarium is also near by and well worth a visit. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: Erlin_10
Reviews.Content: simoky wonderful... sight un seen, chose it for the location, and got so much more! Will stay here whenever we are in Seattle, never anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel we can remember staying at.”
Reviews.Author: loranfa
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel make the difference. The location is perfect. The rooms are comfortable, but the friendliness and the helpfulness of the staff really make the difference. They set up tours for us that were perfect. We had a picnic every day in our room with treats we bought at Beecher Cheese, Le Panier, and Pike Market. These were all an easy walk even for someone like me who has mobility issues. The staff helped with reataurant suggestions. Our room was spotless. There was a beautiful bouquest of flowers waiting for us when we arrived. We would not even consider staying anywhere else when we return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: peterlc63
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a quick trip to celebrate our anniversary and it could not have been better staying at the Inn at the Market and exploring Pike Place! The hotel is in the best spot to enjoy the market and the rooftop deck was fantastic! We had a city view room that that was very nice and was very quiet. Could barely hear the people were staying in the adjoining rooms and street noise was not a problem for us on the 4th floor. They even had a nice business center where I could print our boarding passes. The bed was very comfortable and the room was just very cozy overall. The entire staff is very friendly, helpful, and welcoming. We had breakfast at one of the Inn's restaurant's and the crab eggs benedict was superb! Our favorite place to go at Pike Place was La Panier Bakery just down the street. We bought croissants all three days we were there! The biggest problem you will have is deciding where to eat! The monorail is five short blocks away so you can easily go to the Space Needle and the EMP museum. The waterfront is also a short walk away. It was a fantastic trip for my wife and I.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tmf3a
Reviews.Content: DH and i went to Seattle a few weeks ago for a vacation. Since this was a top hotel listing here on Trip Advisor, and close to the market we wanted to stay here. I followed them on Twitter and asked for the Twitter rate, which was great. We booked with them online, and it was all very easy. They also sent us a reminder email with confirmation # a week before, which is always appreciated :) We were very impressed with the location, our room, the roof deck and the employees. The employees were beyond helpful with directions, recommendations and they saved us a lot of time by telling us which buses to take, and the best ways to get to places outside of downtown. when we return to Seattle we will be staying here again. also, the hotel was doing some work during our stay- testing fire alarms, and working on sewer system. they gave us plenty of notice the previous evenings and we were not inconvenienced at all. we really appreciated them letting us know.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: r0ckhill
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews of Inn at the Market, I'm having a difficult time adding to the accolades. We were there for six nights and thoroughly enjoyed every minute. Our room was beautiful (fantastic bed linens) with a breathtaking view of the water. We were in room 804, and the picture on the website of the water view room is entirely accurate. There was even a complementary bottle of wine waiting for us when we arrived. The service at the hotel is also wonderful. I had to buy flowers at the market (couldn't resist), and the hotel provided a vase. Also the hair dryer was not working properly, but within a couple of hours of letting the desk know, a new dryer was installed. As everyone has said, the location is perfect--many lovely restaurants, wine bars, shops, as well as the Market are at your fingertips. When we returned home, we watched "Sleepless in Seattle," which we hadn't seen for many years. We were delighted to see views of the market, the Athenian where Tom Hanks ate with his friend, and--to make it even better--we saw the Inn at the Market! It made us wish we were still there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: mommalugg3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at 'The Inn at the Market last week for a short get away. We were really impressed by everything at this hotel. The location was great. It was just up the hill from the Pike Market and many little shops and restaurants in the area. The service was impecable. Everyone at the Inn was so friendly and helpful. All you had to do was ask and they went out of their way to help you. We asked for a taxi a couple of times and the front desk made their town car available to us. The room itself was beautiful. We had a water front suite with a wonderful view.....and the beds were very comforable. Couldn't have asked for a better experience. Would recommend this hotel very highly !!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, very relaxed.”
Reviews.Author: rasnews
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect location, the hotel is clean, the beds comfy, the views from the deck awesome, the staff alert and helpful, plenty of restaurants around, lots to see and do within walking distance, the public transit is free in the downtown area for a little further jaunts, lots of unique shops to explore, lots of architectural details on the buildings, lots of green spaces, lots of good seafood, jazz, chocolate and coffee. Great day trips from here too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: KHootch
Reviews.Content: Though we only stayed one night, we had a fantastic experience. Booked on-line which was very easy and even received a much appreciated reminder e-mail a week out. We were a little worried that the hotel would feel dated from a previous visit several years ago and some on-line traveler's photos but we were amazingly surprised. The upgrades and renovations are terrific. We lucked out with a full view of the market. My brother who lives right around the corner normally steers his guests to the Four Seasons but after visiting our room, stated that he will now always recommend the Inn at the Market.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, unsatisfactory room”
Reviews.Author: Norcal-Saratoga
Reviews.Content: Great location. Staff was very friendly. We stayed in a bi- level room with a pullout couch for the kids. The room decor was outdated and a bit musty. The room faced the street and the noise at night made sleeping difficult-- the rooms just don't seem well insulated from the noise. We checked out early and went to the four seasons instead for just a bit more money. Perhaps the other rooms at the Inn are better. We were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The mist wonderful hotel for our wedding night!”
Reviews.Author: Silliker
Reviews.Content: Our day was perfect, and due to an unexpected family friend at your hotel named Wade we arrived to a fabulous room with a huge deck overlooking the market with a full water view unlike another found in Seattle. We would recomend this hotel to everyone who is looking for the best! Great location, best Seattle view, excellent service and thoughtfulness. Also, the bed is so comfy, my husband wants me to find out where we can buy one!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Marketmiami1
Reviews.Content: This was my first time visiting Seattle and I couldn't have been happier with our choice. The location is unbeatable. Steps away from the Market, with some of the best food options located around the hotel. The rooms were excellent, roomy, and the tempurpedic beds had me sleeping like a rock. I thought that the only improvement would be to add their own kitchen so they don't have to rely on the neighboring restaurants for room service. But that was so minor. I also loved the terrace, that was accessible to all guest so they could relax morning or night and watch the harbor and the ships coming in to the market.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Blend of Setting and Service”
Reviews.Author: Archie's Mom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 5 days at the Inn at the Market. From the first moments of checking in when I was asked if I'd prefer a Seattle Times or a New York Times in the morning until the last moments of the bellman carefully packing my rental car, I enjoyed the supreme customer service of this lovely hotel. Our room was beautiful with a great view of the ferries crossing the Sound. Because we were literally only steps from the Pike Street Market, I visited daily, bought fresh flowers and fruit and did some great people watching.The Cafe Campagne associated with the hotel served the best French bistro food we have had anywhere. Steelhead Cafe across the street was also fine, as was Place Pigalle. And all these great restaurants were less than a 2 minute walk! The little patio at the entrance to the hotel contained two lovely shops where I did all my Mother's Day shopping in spite of great other shopping also walking distance away. And the bed? Divine. Room service? Fast and delicious. Overall ambiance? About the best US hotel we have found in many years..

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for plus”
Reviews.Author: karaoke_zale
Reviews.Content: There is nothing better then finding a hotel room that is not a prisoner to clanging waste management teams at 5 AM or machinery starting up at odd hours. When you do find a comfortable and quiet hotel room it is often because you are 35 floors above the noise but quite often looking at the side of another building... Inn at the Market does,nt only provide the serenity of the country in the heart of one of the most active tourist destinations in Seattle, but offers a view of Elliot Bay that is unsurpassed, and the incredable convenience of being in the heart of it all. Attentive and accomodating staff and a good reason to pack your bags and get over there

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views and great location”
Reviews.Author: JeanMcK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for two nights in May 2011. We had booked a double room with water view and were pleased to be upgraded to a deluxe double with a huge patio shared with only one other room. The room and patio overlook the market and waterfront and it was wonderful just to sit and watch the ferries and people going by. The room was big and well appointed with a small kitchenette area. Our only slight disappointment was that there is no bar in the hotel so while there is a lovely 5th floor patio for all guests overlooking the waterfront, there is no bar to order a drink. You either bring your own or use the mini-bar. Apparently, this will be rectified once the restaurant, Campagne, is renovated, but it would make sense if they were to put a bar in the 5th floor where the seating is. Perhaps for the future. Otherwise, a brilliant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and just great”
Reviews.Author: minermet
Reviews.Content: My room and the location of the hotel is unbeatable, just try it

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: travelingmrblhds
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a most enjoyable Seattle extended weekend. Acting on a recommendation from a friend, we booked our stay at the Inn at the Market (IATM). The name couldn't be more appropriate as it is literally steps to Pike Place Market. IATM now became home base for the next four days of sight seeing, economy stimulating, and drinking coffee. The staff was professional and courteous throughout or stay. We found the Inn to be comfortable and enjoyed the view from the deck on that rare Seattle warm spring day. Exemplary service was offered, unsolicited.I had an ankle injury and while my wife was getting ice, a Bell staff offered to pick-up some homeopathic medication. It was delivered to our room shortly thereafter. This is WOW Service! We were also offered and driven to nearby restaurants. For visiting the city of Seattle, this is an ideal location. Walking distance to virtually all points of interest. Public transport is nearby too. The walking is highly recommended, as the excellent eateries are abundant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: YaelT
Reviews.Content: Beautiful gem in the heart of Seattle, two steps from the famous Pike Place Market. Leave your car behind, and walk around the most vaibrant part of Seattle! Open your window, and let the scents and sounds of the market invade your room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Catsaver911
Reviews.Content: The most central hotel with nicely appointed rooms. Service was good. Rooftop deck is worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great night's sleep and best morning juice.”
Reviews.Author: wanderingfork
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night prior to returning home after a business trip. Centrally located near Pike's Place with an easy walk to restaurants (94 Stewart), shops, etc. Check in was easy and staff was friendly and helpful. I had a "courtyard" view instead of a water view. I had not requested a specific view, so I'm not complaining. (I learned that if you want a water view you need to book in advance and call to confirm.) Room and bathroom were large, well lit, with good amenities. Bed was devine and I slept soundly for seven hours without waking up -- usual for me when I'm on the road. No extraneous noise -- a suprise because I later discovered there was a family with a small child next door, but I never heard them. I did not use the business center. Wi-Fi in the room was quick, even with downloading files. Although I did not use room service, I did get juice from Baccos. Baccos made a fabulous apple, carrot, grapefruit juice...squeezed while I waited. I plan to return with my spouse for a special weekend.

Reviews.Title: “What a Location and an Incredible View!”
Reviews.Author: Szupply
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while at a conference and I brought my wife and child along with me. It was a truly exotic place to stay... to walk out the door and be in the hustle and bustle of fabulous Pike Place Market... who could ask for more? Oh but there is! All around us were fabulous restaurants and shopping that made my wife giddy. Anyway, I wish we could afford to stay there more often - it was quite an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Michloh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just had a wonderful 5 nights stay at the inn at the market when we were in Seattle. We will not stay anywhere else ever in Seattle. For the location, the atmosphere and the service I can frankly say it can't be beat. I wake up each morning and open the curtains and see the mountains and the market vendors loading their stores and smile. The service is also very good. We went to pioneer square, bainbridge island with a wonderful ferry ride, Fremont, Ballard and university village. It's so welcoming that I cancelled the Alexis to stay here 2 wks later when we take our flight back home. That tells a lot. î�—

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been more perfect”
Reviews.Author: SimplyHappyinWilbur
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is perfectly located downtown Seattle. Right next to Pike market, the waterfront, and great shopping. Waking up every morning to the smell of fresh baked pastries and hot coffee down at the market is wonderful. The hotel does not have a restaurant but has many great dining options in the area and the staff was very helpful about reccomending where to dine. At first I was disapointed that there was not an in house workout center, but was more than happy when given a pass to the downtown athletic club. The view from our room was amazing right over the water and market

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RamblingShirley
Reviews.Content: My flight out of Seattle after a convention was cancelled and I was lucky to get the last room available for one night at the Inn at the Market. My husband and I had stayed here before nearly 4 years ago. When I arrived, the front desk said, "Welcome back, Mrs. Adler. Do you still prefer the New York Times in the morning?" The location above the wonderful Pike Market is divine with those amazing $10 flower bouquets. And on a clear day you can buy wine, cheese and snacks in the market and then take them to the roof of the Inn for unparalleled views of Elliot Bay. The rooms are luxurious and comfortable and a bargain for what you get. I will always return to this lovely oasis in the remarkable Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeNewMexico
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 weekend nights here during a wet weekend. The hotel is perfectly located within walking distance of the shopping district, many fine restaurants, bars, coffee shops etc. The room was excellent, everything in perfect working order and the staff collectively went out of their way to make this a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Easily surpassed our expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: jonjanet1
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at the Inn at the Market! The staff was MORE than willing to help, and they were all so outwardly positive. What a difference from a mega hotel!!! The proximity to everything was also great...we walked all over town, never needing a car. The room itself had a beautiful view of the whole sound...even were able to see the snow-capped Olympics! The rooms were meticulous...the morning coffee in the lobby wonderful, the cookies checking in...these are little things, but they mean a lot to a guest! Definately want to return! Make sure you have good walking shoes!!! And be prepared to be treated "special"!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: California91
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this wonderful small hotel before and loved it then - and now. Friendly and efficient staff, comfortable and charming rooms, comfortable beds - and the most convenient location around. We look forward to returning to Seattle and will always make this our "home away from home".

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel, perfect location - you cannot go wrong here!”
Reviews.Author: Maryandlee
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, and don't be shy about getting a "partial sea view" or even a street view. The rooms are large, tastefully decorated and the location cannot be beat. The staff will do anything to help and really go out of their way to make sure you're happy with them. This is one of the best hotels on the W Coast. My only suggestion, and it's a small one, don't make me pay the $15 for the gym 2 blks away. It's a great gym, but I wish they'd pick up the tab.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Melry01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for 2 nights and were not disappointed. It had a great location right at Pikes Market but also within walking distance of most other attractions and lots of shopping. The service was excellent from the time we arrived until the time we left. We were greeted daily by the bellmen and lobby staff. I personally felt that the staff went out of their way to accommodate us. My mother is in a wheel chair and where the hotel is located is very hilly and the bellman knew we were having trouble with the chair and the hills, so he gave us a key to the back door that was not on a slope so we could get the chair in and out without any effort. This is exactly the type of service that you can come to expect from an amazing place and staff like this hotel has. The bed was incredible - the best nights of sleep we've ever had away from home. We had our own private rooftop deck that was huge and so beautiful to take pictures from or just take in the amazing views. I would recommend the ocean/Pikes view rooms, as the sight every morning is breathtaking. Not only would I stay here again, but I wouldnâ€™t stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, nice room, comfy bed.”
Reviews.Author: Clearview3000
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location just one block from the water, the best seafood, restaurants and Pike Place Market. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was large, very clean and the bed was extra comfortable. This location was much better than towards downtown (near Nordstroms) where things are scungy. My husband and I loved our two-night stay here I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Where for Leisure or Work, this is the spot”
Reviews.Author: srascally
Reviews.Content: We were involved in four days of all-day conference sessions at the Seattle Trade Center yet we felt as if we were on vacation at the Inn. The combination of warm and professional service was just right: every restuarant recommendation was great; specialized itineraries for our limited touring time were carefully prepared. We were in the heart of the action (barely a half block from Pike Market) but the room and bedding suggested were in the clouds. Seattle's integrated public transport system is always just two blocks away.I highly recommend it whether you have limited time due to business or you have Seattle as a vacation desitnation.

Reviews.Title: “A phenomenal first impression of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: oakcarter
Reviews.Content: Literally steps away from Pike Place Market, the Inn's location is a dream and its accommodations are pleasant, comfortable and welcoming. Enjoying two breakfasts at Bacco Cafe was a great way to start my morning, and my room's water view was a fantastic way to end my day.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: John O
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the first time on a recent trip to Seattle. The great location was the first thing that drew me to this hotel, but after spending two days there, it was really the fantastic service that stood out. Everyone I dealt with at the hotel was super friendly and went out of their way to make me feel welcome. And of course, the location can't be beat! Less than a block from Pike Place Market and within walking distance of the main downtown area. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a capital S”
Reviews.Author: amanda_jnu
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Inn in downtown Seattle and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. I would highly recommend the hotel for it's beautifully appointed rooms, superior staff, and fun location. Located right above the market we could watch the action on the street and out in Elliot Bay from our room. Our room was so beautiful and comfortable, we didn't want to leave. We even enjoyed in-room massages on the morning of our departure. Dinner at The Pink Door and breakfast at Bacco Bistro just steps from the hotel are also highly recommended. My only comment/recommendation is that the hairdryer provided in the bathroom was pretty low quality, the same model you'd expect to find in a 1-star hotel. I would have expected something a tad better in the hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a good nights sleep and great service; This is the place!”
Reviews.Author: CCSDuvall
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are great. The bed is like sleeping on a cloud! I will stay here the next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: travelinggirl64
Reviews.Content: Can't go wrong with this hotel. A true classic. Staff very nice, super efficient. Bell staff amazing, front desk very courteous and helful. Great location, and the restaurant that serves the room service has the best scrambled eggs.. not sure what they do to them, but they are so so so tasty! :) Stay here when in Seattle..you will be very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, wonderful room, great night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Seattlegirl55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Inn at the Market for a weekend getaway - a kind of staycation. I love Seattle and we picked a great, sunny weekend in February. We had a deluxe waterview room which is exactly what we had - a deluxe view. We overlooked Pike's Street Market but had a perfect view of the Sound with all the ferries coming and going, and of the snow-capped Olympics. The sunsets were spectacular. The room was well designed and offered everything we needed - and it was clean. The bed was amazingly comfortable - two of the best night's sleep I have had for a while. There are so many fabulous restarurants in the area, it is hard to choose where to eat. Lots to do with so many famous Seattle landmarks within walking distance - perfect. Valet parking was worth it - and the valets were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, awesome views”
Reviews.Author: LittleTree11
Reviews.Content: Right next to Pike Place Market. Well worth asking for a room with a view of Puget Sound.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: explorer211
Reviews.Content: We had a great time exploring downtown Seattle and the hotel location was extremely convenient. The staff was courteous, the rooms were very nice & the hotel restaurants were fabulous as well. Parking for a large vehicle was a little challenging to find with only verbal directions to guide us, maybe a small map would have been more helpful. Overall it was a memorable experience & one worth repeating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: robdlee
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this location, just a few feet from Pike's Market. It was pouring down rain during our stay so being close to the Market and all the attractions was fantastic. The hotel was very nice, clean rooms, great views. Would love to come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: calgaryally
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Inn January 2ns through 7th, 2011. It was the most amazing stay. The hotel was decorated so well and the courtyard is exquisite. Our room was a 2 level suite and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The bed was the most comfortable bed EVER. The staff was always available for anything we needed. Our room faced the water and as we were 1/2 block from Pike Place we could watch the early morning fish deliveries and ferries arriving and departing. The location is perfect and we walked everywhere. Definitely we will come stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: cpearlLakeChelan
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at the Inn at the Market. We were upgraded to a full water view room and found a delicious treat and card waiting for us (it was our 25th wedding anniversary). Everyone was very kind and helpful. And the location was amazing! We especially enjoyed the rooftop patio. In the morning, we went to Pike's Place Market and bought everything for a wonderful breakfast (fresh squeezed orange juice, smoked salmon, chocolate croissants, strawberries, etc...) and ate it on the deck, enjoying the amazing view. Very romantic. Would highly recommend Inn at the Market and hope to return. Thank you for making our stay so special!

Reviews.Title: “Another WONDERFUL time at the INN!!!”
Reviews.Author: dimsumNE1
Reviews.Content: Besides the fact that the locationm is ideal and within walking distance to so many major attractions, the hotel staff is superb. From the bellmen to the front desk to the housekeeping, etc.. everyone is most professional, friendly and knowledgable! It feels like coming back home each time we are here. We plan to bring our adult children this Fall to enjoy Seattle based out of this wonderful boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: 21TravelJunkie
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay with Inn at the Market and once again it was fantastic! The service... friendly and helpful, the room... a view of the water, comfortable bed and wonderful amenties, the atmosphere... chic but welcoming, the location... central to everything Such a marvelous break, we will return again and again...

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: happymallqueen
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience at the Inn at the Market. Very, very clean. Extremely comfortable bed and bedding. Great location; was able to walk to public transportation. Superb restaurants within walking distance. Used the free business center every night for email. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Loved all of the lights and outlets in the room.

Reviews.Title: “will never stay anywhere else in seattle”
Reviews.Author: BeckyGatdula
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Staff was pleasant and professional. The rooms were spacious. I spent the extra money and stayed in a room with a water view and it was well worth the money. I will always stay at this hotel in the future and have already told my family and friends about it.

Reviews.Title: “We stay here every time we are in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: RonFromSomewhere
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Inn every year since 2004 and decided to return twice last year - once in the summer and once in the winter. Incredible views; extremely comfortable; friendly, thoughtful, and accommodating staff from management to housekeeping; and a location that cannot be beat. Every year we look forward to the Inn as our trip to Seattle would not be the same without it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: alwaysbetraveling
Reviews.Content: I had seen the Inn at the Market a few years ago, and vowed that if I ever returned to Seattle, I'd stay there. I'm so glad I did. The Inn is literally 20 feet from Pike's Market. As you pull up to the valet, someone comes up immediately to help you into the courtyard entrance of the hotel. The lobby is cozy and inviting with the fireplace lit. Checking in was a snap. Our room was facing the street, but with a corner view of the harbor. The king room was spacious and very comfortable. A nice couch and sitting area made the room feel less cramped. The bathroom was clean and classically designed. A refrigerator was nice to store water. There is free Wi-Fi, but no business center to print. However, the staff at the front desk is more than helpful in printing anything you may need if you can direct them to the website. There is a outdoor patio overlooking the harbor. Obviously, it is to be enjoyed when the weather allows, but it looks lovely. Valet parking is available, but a little pricey. The staff is very accomodating and nice. All the past positive reviews about the Inn are true. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are tastefully decorated, spacious and very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Ruth36
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location - right next to Pike Place. The rooms are tastefully decorated, spacious and very comfortable. The only complaint I have is that the heating system in our room was quite noisy when it cycled on and off. Cafe Campagne is an amazingly good restaurant adjacent to the hotel with five-star food. Overall, a lovely boutique hotel well worth the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Seattle's BEST hotel”
Reviews.Author: stev1470
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, modern and classy rooms, friendly service... perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way:room, staff, location, price”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver15
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place to stay, close to the market and yet walking distance to shopping and the Art Museum. Rate for a special package (Picasso) was good.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant introduction to the Pacific NW”
Reviews.Author: keeling_london
Reviews.Content: I visitied Seattle for a weekend before a week of business in Bellvue. It was my first time in the Pacific northwest, so I wanted to be as close as possible to the action in Seattle while staying somewhere comfortable so I could get over my jetlag. Inn on the Market certainly delivered both! Location: literally a hop, skip and jump from the Pike Place Market, and in easy walking reach of most attractions (Space Needle, Pioneer Square, Belltown, International District... the list goes on). Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. A great place for someone new to Seattle to get their bearings. Comfort: this is a really charming boutique hotel. It's got soul, plus all of the tick-boxes: enormous comfy bed, spacious bathroom, nice robes, warm cosy lobby with fire, great staff, excellent food in the restaurants (we had breakfast at Bacco both mornings - truly great coffee, I'm Australian so I know about these things). It's also got free wifi, which is so nice after being rorted by countless big hotels for use of their network, and a beautiful deck from which you can admire the Puget Sound. The only criticism I would make is that the air conditioning in the room was quite loud and would go on and off intermittently throughout the day and night. Not a problem for me as I wear earplugs anyway (conditioned by years of city living) but it has the potential to be an issue if you are a sensitive sleeper. All in all I would recommend Inn at the Market to anyone: couples, business travellers, families. It's great. Just book it.

Reviews.Title: “Picasso”
Reviews.Author: willbikeforwine
Reviews.Content: Great room, stunning view, good food, wine and of course Picasso exibit. We always come here

Reviews.Title: “The view was breathtaking and the staff was kind and helpful”
Reviews.Author: sboeshaar
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so accommodating, friendly and helpful. The view was tryly amazing. It was so fun watching the business of the market from the peacefulness of the room. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: likeslocalstuff
Reviews.Content: This spot really does have a prime location. You are right at the market, hence the name. I was here for the entertainment package at the Triple Door. It was a great price and it included free parking and done by the valet. Nice touch. There was a little bit of a mixup though and things did not go according to plan BUT they did fix it for me later on and that made all the difference. The room was very clean and tastefully decorated. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was really a good size and I liked their amenities as well as the lighted magnifying makeup mirror. There was only 1 nightstand with a lamp though which seemed a little odd. Also, the sound of the aircon was pretty loud so I ended up shutting it off. There was also a strange sound like a whirring of motors that went off and on and was thinking it might have been something coming from the courtyard or maybe the elevators. Not sure if I would stay here again. The Triple Door package is a pretty good deal though so I might still think about that and try it again. Jury is still out.

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoy staying here. Will continue to use when in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: GPSIG
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at The Inn At The Market. Have enjoyed the hotel every time. Great location and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Gem !”
Reviews.Author: anitamaquar
Reviews.Content: This is the most wonderful hotel in Seattle! Get a water view room, you will never want to leave! Watch the Washington State Ferry come and go and look down on all the activity milling through the Pike's Place Market below. A bit of Europe at your door steps!....Location, location, location. Not to mention the staff was warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently great”
Reviews.Author: EsamM
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to this hotel was Dec 23 2010. First visit was May 2009. Perfect location. Amazing staff. Views are great especially if not rainy or foggy. Had to delay initial reservation because of personal circumstances and IATM was extremely accommodating and understanding. The only place we'll stay at in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very Frazier Crane Worthy! Perfect location for a Seattle experience!”
Reviews.Author: RoseOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: Small lovely boutique hotel. Very Frazier Crane! Professional, friendly staff. Perfect location for experiencing the public market and surrounding sights. Took in the Picasso exhibit at the Seattle Art Museum, which just is a block or two away. Lots of fun visiting thelively public market area during the Christmas season. Beautiful sweeping view of Seattle waterfront and market from our suite, which had a large, wemi-private large patio area off our suite. Easy walk to large number of great restaurants. We had a wonderful french dinner across the courtyard at Le Campagna. We are anxious to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: broad047
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location. Walk outside the front door and your at Pike's Place. Walking distance to everywhere, you won't need to rent a car. The staff was helpful and warm. The hotel has a nice atmosphere with the fireplace, waterfall outside and the views are wonderful. I highly recommend this hotel and wouldn't stay anywhere else. Not one negative thing to report.

Reviews.Title: “stay in the water view rooms”
Reviews.Author: mickeyre
Reviews.Content: fabulous location 1/2 block from Pike's Place...very clean and quiet with incredible views and very friendly service...we'll be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Awesome Location.”
Reviews.Author: ZTraveler63
Reviews.Content: This Places rocks, Super clean and friendly staff . Walking distance to everything. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn at the Market was our best Seattle hospitality experience we've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: Sach79
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled with friends to Seattle for the Picasso Exhibit at SAM and was pleasantly surprised by the wonderful treatment we received at the Inn at the Market. From the moment we arrived, our car was whisked away to parking as we checked in to our beautiful townhouse, water view, suite. WOW!!! The room was impeccably clean and had everything we could have possibly needed. The Staff was welcoming and down to earth. Their dining recommendations were great! Even after checking out, they allowed us to stay parked, held our shopping purchases as we continued to shop and when our car was delivered, it was already packed with our purchases and luggage! Thank you, thank you, thank you, Inn at the Market Staff! We WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful room in a wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: mscjm
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three days in Seattle and chose The Inn at The Market because of it's location and because it was offering a Picasso ticket and room package for the traveling exhibition. We were a short walk from the Settle Art Museum, lots of shopping, and just steps away from Pike's Market. We reserved a room with a "partial view" and very much enjoyed being able to see the water and all the ferry and freight activity. The room was enormous with a desk and chair, (free Internet access), and an additional table with two comfortable reading chairs. There were three sets of windows providing plenty of light and both water and city views. Service at the hotel was top notch with employees at the desk, bellmen, and room service personnel being both friendly and helpful. We ate twice at Cafe Campagne, one of two restaurants associated with the hotel, and the food and service were both outstanding. I would recommend this hotel to travelers who want to enjoy leisure time in a lovely room as well as walk around and explore a busy and lively area of Seattle. i The only slight drawback is a bit of traffic noise at night, but it wasn't enough to keep us from enjoying a good night's rest.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Seattle Holiday Shopping Trip”
Reviews.Author: shoppinginseattle
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place to enjoy a holiday week-end away to shop with family and experience the wonderful sights of downtown Seattle. Located at the Pike Place Market with lots going on. Convenient to all the shopping areas by foot. No parking worries, the hotel will keep your car (for your paid valet charge) after check out until 6 pm at no extra fee and will store your bags as well. Wonderful clean rooms with cozy beds. The heating units are independently operated in each room and are a bit noisy. Fans directed at the beds, which if you're not used to, could keep you up at night. Would be great to have a 'dimmer' switch on the very bright bathroom lights.

Reviews.Title: “It completed an utterly fabulous visit to see the unique world class Picasso exhibition at the Seattle Art Museum.”
Reviews.Author: JohnEmery
Reviews.Content: We wanted to visit Seattle to see the Picasso Exhibition which is currently on show at the Seattle Art Museum. While checking different hotels on line, we found that the "inn at the Market" had a great offer which included tickets to the show plus complimentary valet parking until 5pm the following day. Since we drove down from Vancouver, BC for this visit, this arrangement was perfect for us. When we had made our reservations, we had requested a room with 2 beds. When we walked into our room, no: 419, we found that we had a corner room, possibly the best room in the hotel with large floor to ceiling windows overlooking the Public Market sign at Pike's Place and fabulous views of the sea and all the ferry traffic. The room was very quiet, very spacious and exquisitely furnished with the most tasteful art and decor. On top of all that, there are two excellent restaurants in the hotel, the Campagne and Bacca plus you are in the heart of the marketplace.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: MayeBar
Reviews.Content: Everything was great! We arrived before check-in, but we were pleasantly greeted and they offered to hold our luggage since our room was not yet ready. The front desk offered me a walking map of the area and suggestions on places to see nearby, and later phoned to let us know as soon as our room was available. We ordered room service one morning and had some really great food. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot say enough good.”
Reviews.Author: Thebaldtraveler
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at The Inn at the Market many times and they get better every time. The people from the front desk to room service are the nicest, most professional staff possible. The rooms are immaculate as is the entire facility. The location is the best in Seattle. You walk out the door and into the center of the fabulous Pike Place Market. The best market in the U.S. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwynathome
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally steps from Pike Street Market. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. A nice touch was offering a place, and supplies, to gift wrap presents you may have bought. A very nice rooftop deck offers beautiful waterfront views. A bit chilly, since we were there in December; would like to check it out again in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Amazine, couldn't ask for more.”
Reviews.Author: smclarty
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Even though the hotel seems well established, the rooms were perfect and extremely clean. The only thing I would add would be a fitness center. Missed having this inside the hotel. The location is amazing, and simply cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but the views are glorious and the location and staff are wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ChericKaufman
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at the Inn at the Market to celebrate our 25th anniversary . We had a room with a view of Puget Sound that was glorious (even though you also see a few roofs as well as the water and the iconic sign of the public market)! We made the choice to stay at the Inn (rather than the Edgewater) because of the TripAdvisor reviews of both (Edgewater got bad reviews for management, staff, and noisiness) and I am thrilled that we chose the Inn at the Market. The staff was so gracious and friendly, the beds were the most comfortable we have ever slept in (Hypnos mattresses - we asked!), it was quiet, the rooms and the view were perfect, and the location is wonderful (while Edgewater is away from the center). We were only a few steps away from fresh fruit at the Pike Place Market, locally made Beecher's cheese, a wonderful wine shop, the best gelato we have had in the states, great clam chowder, amazing European hot chocolate made from chocolate shavings at the Chocolate Box , and International restaurants and bakeries (from crumpets to Piroshky's!)- all within a few blocks. We had picnics every day! The location is perfect for a stay without a car. The light line from the airport took only 37 minutes even when it is snowing, as it was on our last day. The light rail line ends 3 blocks from the Inn and costs only $2.50! The Seattle Art Museum (now showing a marvelous Picasso exhibit from Paris), Pioneer Square, the Seattle Center (for theatre) and the harbor/lock tours are close enough to walk. And shopping is only a few blocks to the east. The Inn is expensive but worth it. We do NOT recommend the cafe Champagne. The cafe is highly rated but the food was almost inedible - maybe just a bad night - or maybe it is resting on its good reviews?

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip of Our Dreams”
Reviews.Author: jneslund
Reviews.Content: Two nights at the Inn at the Market seemed out of our reach until we found the special package that they had to attend the Picasso exhibit at the Seattle Art Museum. The package included parking and tickets to SAM. We booked the package for two nights or we thought but when we got there we discovered that we had one night at the regular price, which was fine except for the $30 per night parking. The hotel kicked that in for free and we were off to a weekend of family, sightseeing and shopping. We had a street view room and no room in downtown Seattle is quiet on a weeknd night. A few buses, a fight and an accident woke us up but we fell right back to sleep. The location could not be better. We walked everywhere and brought family back for a bit of pre-dinner socilization. The room was great for two people, very quiet and clean. For us out of towners, it was a trip of our dreams. The internet was a little slow but fast enough for us to get to our email and weather links.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ctbeachbum131
Reviews.Content: Being a guest at the Inn at the Market for my first trip to Seattle was exceptional. The hotel staff were more than accommodating, the room was very comfortable, and the location was in the middle of the Pike Place Market area and close to the downtown area. Coffee on the rooftop overlooking the Sound, ahhhh! Look forward to returning to Seattle -- loved the city!

Reviews.Title: “Urban Getaway”
Reviews.Author: FatYeti
Reviews.Content: My wife and I like to play tourist in our own town about once a quarter, we have gone to other hotels but always return to the Inn at the Market. Make a point to get a water view room. The location cannot be beat. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: gsamson
Reviews.Content: Of course the location is what separate this place from other hotels in seattle. It's just so centralized to everything, even both stadiums is a short walk. i would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Inn at the Market prepared a perfect room with a friendly staff and a spectacular water view.”
Reviews.Author: aklomparens
Reviews.Content: The room was immaculately clean and well-appointed. The views of the market and Puget Sound from the room and view deck were well worth the price. The room-service meal (chamberdin (sp?), steak frites, and creme broulee) from Cafe Campagne was the second best I have ever enjoyed (the best was the same meal in Paris 10 years ago.) I definitely hope to make Inn at the Market a birthday tradition for my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Best location to see the real Seattle”
Reviews.Author: TravellingRN01
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay in this hotel and we now think of it as "our place to stay" in Seattle. We are from Seattle and now live in Portland. We love to wake up looking out over Elliot Bay with the Pike Place Market right outside of the lobby. For convenience it can't be better with downtown Seattle shopping just two to three blocks away, buses and light rail, the symphony hall, art museum and lots of food and drink literally right outside your door. There is also a hotel towncar available at certain times or cabs right in front of the hotel so we take the train to Seattle and leave the car at home. The staff is really friendly and professional. The smaller size of the hotel makes our stay much more personal and calm than the feel of one of the larger hotels. Staying at Inn at the Market just makes relaxing much easier when we're vacationing in Seattle. We highly recommend it to get a good feel for the "real Seattle".

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: bharris123
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to price/location and were not disappointed. It is clean and very comfortable but the one thing that will keep us coming back is the friendliness of the staff. Everyone there seemed truly pleased that we were staying at the hotel and encouraged us to come back again. We certainly will.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: mickeycaprelo
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, great rooms, good price .. would recommend to anyone .. everything you want in walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: irishiron
Reviews.Content: We stayed in townhouse room for 4 nights. The hotel is directly across from the market and we did have a view of the water, but unless you have a burning desire for this view, the room is not worth the price. The room, while nice, was not worth $400/night. The downstairs is actually a little cramped and, with only one bathroom, it made it a little inconvenient for the 3 of us. You can open the "balcony" door, but you can't go out. It is actually just a window that opens. I really think that you can do better staying further down first street at one of the other hotels. Location just isn't worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: athomas255
Reviews.Content: In our first visit to Seattle we couldn't have made a better choice. Great location; excellent room; friendly staff; good restaurants nearby. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: FrancesNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: The Inn at the Market has a perfect location for those who appreciate unique aspects of Seattle... Pike Market, water, views, cafes, shops, galleries, and a diverse population. The Inn offers excellent accommodations and service, handsome design, and a sweet entrance through a courtyard. We did not use their concierge services, because we are familiar with Seattle and have family there, but they are prepared to guide the first-timer. The Business Center is free for guests and well equipped. Rooms with water views are highly recommended, even though more expensive. And check out the roof deck on the 5th floor.... views to Puget Sound and the Olympic Mts.! To die for!

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated--more like an Express Holiday Inn with a great view.”
Reviews.Author: jogiese
Reviews.Content: This hotel delivers no service except for the excellent bell men who bring in your luggage when you check in and bring out your luggage when you check out. They redecorated our market-view suite in dark, somber brown tones. Ugh. The place is clearly coasting on its past laurels. Don't try asking for morning coffee to be brought up to your room. A grumpy person brings it up--in a paper cup.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are completely right, this is a great place!”
Reviews.Author: JaneEmery
Reviews.Content: I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to everyone, we went through the reviews before booking a place to stay in Seattle and I am so glad we did. Before we arrived at the hotel I contacted David Watkins, the manager, to ask if he could possibly arrange that our daughter, who had booked separately, could be accommodated in a room as near to ours as possible. From that point forward we had several email exchanges with both Mr Watkins and Noelle, the concierge, giving us advice and tips about our stay in Seattle. By the time we actually arrived we felt that we knew them so well! Our rooms were close together as requested and they were excellent, very clean and spacious with the most comfortable beds. Because we were celebrating our anniversary a bottle of champagne was in the room when we checked in, a lovely touch. Every staff member we encountered was pleasant and couldn't do enough to help you. There was not one thing that we would change with this hotel. The location could not be bettered, a few feet from the market, and with lots of shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. We loved Seattle and the Inn at the Market and we will be going back again as soon as possible. Believe the reviews here, they are correct and you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience I've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: KLHTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hands down, my stay at the Inn at the Market is the best hotel experience I have ever had. The staff is super-friendly, the location is unbeatable, the rooms are large, and the bed and bathroom are wonderful. Breakfast at Bacco was fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: hfangary
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Seattle for the weekend to celebrate her birthday. We stayed at Inn at the Market for three nights and had a great time. We reserved an awesome room on the 6ish floor that had a great view. The service was excellent, and the room was comfortable and clean. The location is outstanding -- close to eveyrhing. We took the monorail to the Space Needle, and then walked back to the hotel -- very nice walk with great views. We also took the Duck tour which was a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional except for comfort of bed”
Reviews.Author: ellie11148
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is terrific but for one thing and that is the comfort of the bed. It was quite hard and uncomfortable. However, the location was perfect and so was the ambience. The room was quite roomy and lovely. Everything was sparkling clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. There is a deck on the 5th floor that overlooks Pike Market and Elliot Bay. There were rarely other people there and the view and feel of the place was wonderful. I recommend a stay there even though the bed in our room made for a tough night sleep. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Benchmark for quality and service”
Reviews.Author: TwoJaysPerth
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed four nights at The Inn at the Market hotel in Seattle and can do nothing but highly recommend it to other travellers. We had a partial water view room that overlooked the patio area and water, which we booked via the Internet. The room was large, spotlessly clean as was the bathroom and the hotel generally. Any question or request made to the hotel reception staff was dealt with efficiently and all in a warm and friendly manner. The hotel is located just metres away from the Pike Market and Aquarium, and the water front activities in general. Being an avid tea drinker I find that you can not make tea in a coffee pot and when I requested a kettle it was delivered virtually before I hung up the phone. Guests are invited to use the patio area, and to even take snacks, food and drink up to the patio. The hotel uses Bacco Restaraunt for breakfast in room service, which we did not use as in room service, but we did have breakfast there on our last day and it was very good value for money and excellent food. If/when we return to Seattle we will definitely be staying at Inn at the Market.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway and location!”
Reviews.Author: wannabeguide
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Inn at the Market just recently. It is in the perfect location, right across from the Pike Place Market and tons of restaurants. The staff are all very friendly and anxious to help in any way they can. Our room on the 7th floor had a fabulous view overlooking the market and the water. I loved the roof balcony where you could take a bottle of wine, snacks, etc. and even room service, from what I saw. The room was spotless, the bed comfortable (although we are not fans of the temper pedic mattress as it is a bit warm for us). We had room service breakfast several times and it was delivered promptly by one of the cheerful staff. They provide nightly turndown with chocolates and their valet service is very prompt. We had a slight issue with the A/C, which the General Manager, David Watkins, immediately addressed, so from my our perspective, we would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Gem of a retreat in the midst of tourism”
Reviews.Author: SVlocal
Reviews.Content: hecking in late at night, the front desk staff were still cheerful and welcoming! Our room was well equiped to meet our needs. I needed to check the internet and found the small business area delightful, tho staff had obviously found it to be very war and set up a fan - thank goodness! After foing around the dorner the next AM for breakfast, we wished we had ordered room service. nstead of getting into the tourist scene rght away. The Watson Kennedy Shop nearby is a treasure!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, not the luxurious boutique hotel I expected”
Reviews.Author: Jarb46
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly staff but inferior beds and not good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: glenDekalb-Il
Reviews.Content: If you are flying and plan on being in the city most of the time, don't rent a car. You can walk to most tourist attractions. We took a towncar to the hotel and saved 3 days of rental + parking. The Inn is fabulous and would recommend it to anybody. I only wish it stopped raining!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, relaxed stay”
Reviews.Author: PLKGilbert_Arizona
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel, the rooms were nice and service exceptional. The sunroof was terrific to meet friends and enjoy the weather with nice wine and tasty cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at The Inn at the Market is a MUST if you want a slamdunk trip to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: rbyrne88
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay was exceptional. Great location, literally steps from the front door to all that Pikes Market has to offer. Great Views, from either the cool deck or higher rooms. Great rooms, super comfy tempurpedic beds, nice bathrooms, etc. Amazing staff, every encounter was sincere, warm, and gracious. Special "props" go to Wynona. She took our last minute reservations and I casually mentioned we were celebrating our first babymoon. Not only did she remember but she actually got a gorgeous bouquet of flolwers that were waiting for us in the room with a lovely card. We were blown away and this helped set the tone for a GREAT vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and view.”
Reviews.Author: ticktock13
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay! It was extremely pleasant. Nice beds, immaculate rooms and a breath taking rooftop views. The valet guys were the best part. So helpful and polite. I'm pretty sure Dustin made our trip. So many good tips about the city. Thanks Inn at the Market!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sheilashera
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect at this hotel. The water veiw room, the veiws and the roof top deck was breathtaking. The location to the market was great. We took the bus to the game and the monorail to the space needle (both not far from hotel ) . It is not cheap but it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, would stay again anytime.”
Reviews.Author: cibumetvinum
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Not cheap but worth spending that bit extra. Better than the 'chain' hotels, big room and bathroom, very comfortable bed. We booked a room with a view of the bay which was great. Windows open to let in fresh air. Staff were very frindly and helpful. Happily booked tours and cabs for us. The Steelhead restaurand across the road on Pine St is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: ohanatravelers
Reviews.Content: We just spent our 20 year wedding anniversary at the Inn at the Market and couldn't have been more pleased. It felt like a perfected "boutique" hotel. The staff were extremely warm, friendly and helpful. We have actually NEVER experienced the type of service and hospitality that they gave. So many details were handled by them in our 3 night stay with such a "happy to serve you" attitude. They made great recommendations for restaurants after taking the time to figure out what we love! When we arrived in our room there was a scrumptious dessert and anniversary card waiting for us. The room was very large and big windows were fabulous! We stayed in the deluxe waterfront. Bathroom was a good size as well. All linens were of top quality! The bed was the most comfortable bed we have had in any hotel, including Westin ;). One thing that really surprised us was the quite. The building must have been of high quality because we literally did not here ANY hall noise, street noise (even with our window open) All of these positive experiences combined (which have been issues we have experienced dissatifaction with in many hotels) made for a perfect anniversary celebration. My husband and I are so glad we chose the Inn at the Market and will definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “The whole experience was brilliant. Great...”
Reviews.Author: Bayswatertravellers
Reviews.Content: The whole experience was brilliant. Great location for us. The staff were warm and professional and willing to do that little extra something that makes your stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, but hard to find.”
Reviews.Author: bossafin
Reviews.Content: This is a very pretty hotel with lovely, friendly staff in the heart of downtown. Lots of choices in restaurants and bars in the area as well as shopping and tourist stuff. 5th floor terrace was a nice touch, but bring your own cocktails to enjoy the sunset--the hotel has no food or beverage service of its own. Room service comes from nearby restaurants. The entrance is low key, and down a road that looks almost like it isn't a through street, so its easy to miss. Valet will take your car and luggage though, once you find it. Walk to Dahlia Lounge for dinner for some great northwest cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, tremendously helpful, friendly staff, superbly comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: perim
Reviews.Content: This is perhaps my fourth stay at this lovely place. I cannot imagine staying anywhere else in Seattle. In fact, we delayed our vacation by one week, just to stay at Inn at the Market. I am very particular, and appreciate most the quality staff, who go out of there way to make you feel comfortable. Also, the Temperpedic beds and high thread count sheets, sleep well, in ideal locale.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: martolaw
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Inn - not more than 50 yards from Pike Place Market. Great staff and extremely comfortable bed and pillows. There are many nearby cafes, bistros and shopping within easy walking distance. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “It is everything you should expect”
Reviews.Author: Winkj
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. The rooms were spacious, surprisingly quiet for such an active part of downtown, extremely clean, and as advertised. If they said partial water view - you had a view out your window! Room service was on time and the food was good. Valet parking is a must because of location, but a large selection of great restaurants are in walking distance. Staff really knows how to make you feel welcome. It is nice to experience quality customer service in this day of self-serve.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Stellar Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Blugirl97
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Seattle. We came a day early for our Alaskan cruise. We picked the Inn at the Market from pictures and reviews on the internet, as well as its close proximity to the Pike Place Market. We were very impressed with our first impression of the Inn at the Market. The great view of the main entrance of the Pike Place Market, the attractive garden courtyard, and the sleek style of the front lobby. Landon met us at our cab and took custody of all of our bags. We met Noelle at the front counter. Although we were early for our check in time, she took our cell phone number to let us know when our room was ready. We were both incredibly impressed with her extremely friendly attitude and helpful manner. You could tell that she was just a genuinely nice person, and that she wasn't just being polite because it was an obligation for her position. Landon was very professional as well, introduced himself further at the check in desk, and arranged for our bags to be stored so we could begin to see Seattle. When we returned a little while later, we were pleasantly surprised to learn that we had been upgraded to a two story townhouse suite. The room was lovely, and had a stunning city view of the corner of Pine and 1st St. (great for people watching!!). I don't recall the name of the bellhop who brought our luggage to our room, but he was extremely polite and helpful as well. He filled our ice bucket before leaving. We were actually SAD that we had to leave the next day to go on our cruise!! Both Seattle and the Inn at the Market greatly exceeded our expectations. We hope to return soon, and will plan to stay at the Inn at the Market again. I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Seattle. It is located right at the entrance to Pike Place Market. The market is interesting, a wonderful place to pick up some handmade souvenirs by local artists, and a terrific place to try different ethnic foods. Within walking distance - The first Starbucks, The Seattle Aquarium, The Westlake Center Mall, a major bus / train stop (at the mall), Piroshky Piroshky (Russian pastries at the market), Pike Place Chowder (at the market), Le Panier (French pastries at the market). A helpful hint: You can take the train to and from Sea-Tac Airport for $2.50 a person one way. Much cheaper than the $45 fare from the airport or the $35 fare to the airport. It is really easy to use too... just go to the bottom floor of the mall. You can also catch the monorail from the top floor of the mall... we did not take this, but you can go to the Space Needle using this (cheaper than a taxi also). .

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: Tommy-Tbone
Reviews.Content: The Inn at the Market was in a fantastic location right at the "Market". Our room was perfect...clean, spacious with quality amenities. We did not have a waterview room but we enjoyed the beautiful roof-top patio overlooking the water. The services were superb and when we come back to Seattle, we would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, great service”
Reviews.Author: ChapinChapin
Reviews.Content: Truly enjoyed 3 night stay. Excellent location with easy walking or ease of use public transportation available. Staff service and assistance were also excellent in all regard.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Seattle Experience”
Reviews.Author: Characterguy
